boardgame.name: Zp9 "Abfahren!"
boardgame.description:
The trains start at the upper right corner (train depot). Movement is determined by a die. On an uneven roll the train has to follow the blue arrow, on an even roll the red arrows. On some spaces signals und signs affect movement. Naturally the trains can not pass each other on the tracks.

The first player to get his train to the destination station (below the depot) wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Red Book of The Elf King Rules
boardgame.description:
This A4 softcover rulebook allows players to play a game which details the Elf Civil War, set in The Isles of Eas.

Contains full-colour illustrations, lore, & narratives from the Isles of Eas; with detailed rules, stats, & scenarios for every Circle and Wyrd Meeting within the Isles.

—description from the publisher (edited)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Second Book of The Elf King Troll Wars Rules

boardgame.name: Alone in the Tower
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are the young heir of a royal house, trapped in a tower in the wilderness. Legends have spread of your predicament, and (if your tally marks of the days passing are correct) the prophesied day of your freedom is fast approaching...

This is a solo tabletop roleplaying game. You'll need a standard 52-card deck of playing cards, a six-sided die, and some method of writing to record your story.

This game is a hack of Takuma Okada’s Alone Among the Stars.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Penrith Edition
boardgame.description: The traditional Monopoly board game but featuring locations from the Penrith area within the state of NSW, Australia.

boardgame.name: Khepri
boardgame.description:
The High Priest of the Order has passed away, after some good years of service, leaving the place vacant. Now the God-Emperor of Egypt must deliberate who will fill the position.

After a revealing dream, where the God-Emperor has a conversation with the God Khepri himself (Scarab God of Ancient Egypt), it is decided that the way of election must be by confronting the Priests to a battle of cunning and strategy that will leave one of them on top.

In Khepri, players play the role of an aspiring Priest of the Order of Khepri. The winner of the game will be elected the new High Priest.

Khepri is a board game for 2 to 4 PLAYERS, where there is no chance, therefore what prevails is strategy and logic. It is an abstract game where the number of players, per game, forces to change the strategy to win. Duration: 30 min. to 45 min.
The rules are very easy to learn, as they occupy only 1 sheet of paper. Three types of maneuvers, movement and how to score.

The game has been completely designed by Pere Martinez, who already has some other experience in this game world, such as Kao.
For the magnificent illustration of the box and the design of the board we have counted on Amy Kitsune.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Guca 3
boardgame.description: Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than). Modify the groups already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones, even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!

boardgame.name: Guca 5
boardgame.description:
Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than, additions/subtractions and equalities). Modify the groups that are already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!
A morea advanced version of Guca 3.

boardgame.name: The Second Book of The Elf King Troll Wars Rules
boardgame.description:
Writer of the cult hit The Red Book of The Elf King, Rick Priestley presents the first expansion to the game since its release! The Second Book of The Elf King explores the Outer Isles, with a whole new Campaign, leading to a Hellish conclusion. Players will rewrite the History of Eas in their wake. The game features a total of six new Circles being introduced into the game, alongside Scenario characters. and a vast new array of spell lists and rules adding on to the base game. Requires the first Book - The Red Book of The Elf King - to play.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Red Book of The Elf King Rules

boardgame.name: Shanzhai
boardgame.description:
Shanzhai is a fast playing pick-up and deliver, economic game in which you’re a “businessman” dealing counterfeit goods, trying to make more money than your rivals. Get deals from the local traders, complete them by selling the required goods, maybe gamble with the money you make and see if you’re lucky enough to double your income. You need to be fast and witty though, the more deals you complete the sooner the police come, will you bribe them or completely avoid them?

Shanzhai (Chinese: 山寨; pinyin: shānzhài) is a Chinese term that means counterfeit products.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Poppycock!
boardgame.description:
Bit of a boff or more of a blagger? Poppycock! is the hilarious trivia game that rewards big brains and mischievous mouths. Challenge friends and family as you Poppycock! your way through a series of quiz questions. Unsure of an answer but think you can get away with bluffing? Deceive your opponents until they shout out Poppycock! Clever meets crafty in this tactical game guaranteed to make you laugh out loud.

Choose a player to answer the first question. That player rolls the dice. The player to their right reads them the question from the category shown on the dice. If the dice is blank, the player answering the question may choose whichever category they want. The question, and multiple-choice answers, are read out, without the questioner turning over the card. The answering player must declare whether they know it or don’t know it. If they don’t know it, the turn ends, the questioner turns the card over and reads out the answer, and play continues clockwise. Discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player.

If they declare they know it, the player must declare how many spaces they are playing for. The player can declare 1, 2, or 3 spaces. This represents how many spaces they will be allowed to move if they get the answer right, or if no one challenges their answer. Additionally, this number represents the number of spaces other players will be allowed to move if they correctly Poppycock! the player answering the question (i.e. if they can determine that the player is trying to bluff). Once the answering player has declared whether they know it, and how many spaces they are playing for, players take turns to say Poppycock! if they do not believe them, or Persuaded! if they do. Starting with the player to the left of the answering player, each player must declare Poppycock! or Persuaded!

If all players are Persuaded!, the answering player will move their declared number of spaces, without having to provide an answer. If any amount of players shout Poppycock!, an answer must be given by the answering player. This answer is checked by the questioner on the reverse of the card. If the answering player was correct, they move forwards their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves backwards that number of spaces. If the answering player was incorrect, they go back their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves forwards the declared number of spaces. When all moves have been resolved, discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player. Proceed in a clockwise direction, with the player to the answering player’s left being the next player to roll the dice and answer a question.

boardgame.name: WanderSquares: The Underwood Tunnels
boardgame.description:
WanderSquares is a fantasy table-top adventure game for players 9 and up. It features an ever-changing map, a choose-your-path adventure guide and 16 inspiring characters to choose from.


An Ever-changing Map - The WanderSquares map is made up of 32 interlocking Adventure Squares. Each square is a tiny story; with monsters, puzzles and treasure. The map grows in endless combinations with each new direction the players choose. Three Special Squares contain major magic items (and mini-bosses). Recover the treasure and you'll unlock the final challenge.
Search for Hidden Treasure - Explore each square to uncover Treasure Cards. You’ll find powerful potions, special weapons, useful gear and magical creatures that will help you in your quest.
The Adventure Guide - Each square of the map has a matching page in the choose-your-path Adventure Guide that describes the scene and the actions the players can take. Once the players choose an action, turn the page to see what happens next.


—description from the dersigner

boardgame.name: Guyenne
boardgame.description:
Guyenne is a card game of bluff, hand management and castle conquest, with a historical flavour.

The name "Guyenne" refers both to the hereditary duchy of the English crown resulting from the Treaty of Brétigny signed in 1360 and to the battle cry of the Anglo-Guyenne armies during the Hundred Years War.

Players compete in successive rounds. They play the cards in their hand to take control of as many of the castle defences as possible that face them. But their forces are limited, and they must be used at the right moment to get the final victory.

Each game turn consists of two phases (laying cards and resolving battles) during which both players are alternately attacker and defender.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 10 Clues
boardgame.description: A trivia game where you get 10 clues to guess the answer. The player may make one guess per clue to identify the person, place, or thing. The more clues the player uses, the fewer points they earn (10 points for a correct guess on the first clue, 9 points on the second clue, 8 on the third, and so on). Players rotate reading the clues and guessing until each player has guessed a few cards (suggested play is 4 cards per each player). Whoever earns the highest points total wins the game.

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler
boardgame.description:
The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler expansion includes:

- 4x miniatures: The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler, 3x Wattle Gobblets
- Over 20 game cards including Wattle Gobbler boss announcements and events.
- Digital PDF Scenario to battle the the Wattle Gobbler
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Cruella De Vil Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

Puppy Tokens: Track the 99 puppies that Cruella DeVil needs with these 12 red paw-shaped tokens. They are engraved on both sides and have the same numbering and text as the cardboard (but these look much cuter!). They are about 1" x 1".

The 3D-printed dog bone is perfect to hold Cruella's Puppy tokens!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Special Movers Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
I'm not the only one that forgets about the cards that need to be moved, right?

Here is a set of markers you can use as reminders. There's the Sheriff of Nottingham's gold medallion, Hades' Chariot, Shadow Man's hat, a Raven for you-know-who, Cruella's Roadster, the Robot Queen's crown, Ratigan's Airship & the Magic Mirror card even gets an actual mirror in a wooden frame!

The set includes all eight. They're each between 1-2 inches.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Strength Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Keep track of your strength with this set of twenty 2-sided, laser-engraved acrylic Strength tokens.

The black side says -1 and the white side is +1. Place the appropriate side on your card to help you remember when another card in the Realm has Abilities that are in effect that change your Hero or Ally's strength.

You don't just want to throw your Strength in the box though, right? The nifty little screw-top container coordinates perfectly with the tokens.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Fliptown
boardgame.description:
Fliptown is a flip-and-write game in which you are trying to earn stars by exploring a wild west town. The game uses a standard poker deck to drive an open world-style of game play, along with dry erase boards or print-and-play sheets that serves as each player's map.

Each turn, flip over three cards, assigning one card to represent your suit, one card to represent your value, and one card to represent your poker card. The suit dictates which of four regions you activate, the value dictates which site within that region you get to circle, and the poker card goes toward a five-card poker hand that is resolved at the end of each round. Each of the four regions — Trail, Badlands, Mine, and Town — offers a different puzzle to master, while each site within a region provides a unique reward such as cash, gold, helpful items like guns, horses and tools, or bonus actions to create powerful combinations.

For solo play, you can play to achieve a high score or compete against one of four "cowbot" robot opponents, each with its own motivation.

For multiplayer play, players use "community cards" in the center of play, with players resolving each turn simultaneously. Additionally, bounty cards add competitive goals that players are racing to achieve.

In addition to the standard game, you can play as one of 14 wild west characters. Each character has a unique set of starting resources and a unique special ability.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Alhambra: Acrylic Tile Tower
boardgame.description:
This tile tower made from Acryl and is used to store the upcoming tiles for the market.
It was part of one of the bundles of the Kickstarter of the Alhambra Big Box 2nd Edition, but the Acrylic tile tower can also be bought separately on the website of queen games.

boardgame.name: 果てにたゆたい底にただよう (Hate ni tayutai soko ni tadayou)
boardgame.description:
In 果てにたゆたい底にただよう (Hate ni tayutai soko ni tadayou) (Flapping at the Beyond and Drifting at the Bottom) is a card game from Japan, in which the players try to score the most points.

On your turn, play one card in front of you (typically face down) and one card to the center of the table (typically face up), then draw 2 cards.

At the end of the game, the player with the most value in each suit will collect the lowest valued card of that suit from the center of the table as points.
user summary

The publisher says:
2枚のカードを得点と得点を取るためのカードに分けていきます。
最終的に得点として分けられたカードをそれぞれが持つカードで取り合います
種類ごとの合計値が高い人から低い点数のカードを取ります。
最終的に特典カードの合計値の高い人が勝利します。

Players take turns to receive 2 cards per turn, then divide them into a card for scoring points (placed in the center of the table face up/down) and a card kept in hand (placed in front of each player face down/up) for taking such cards.

After dividing all the cards, players compete to take the cards for scoring points by the cards in their hands.

For each suit, players take turns to take a card for scoring points in ascending order of rank, in descending turn order of the total rank of the cards of the suit in each player's hand. At the end, the player with the most scoring points wins the game.
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Camel Up: Meeple Source 5-Piece Set of Character Camels
boardgame.description:
This set of 5 wooden meeples can be used to replace the camel tokens that come with Camel Up.

This set contains:

5 screen printed camel meeples

boardgame.name: 7 Wonders: Architects – Egyptian Cat Statue Promo
boardgame.description: Promo mini that replaces the standee in base game.

listing.notes: Sealed. Shipping is 7 euros for this item.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling In/Out Cards
boardgame.description: Track your In and Out status during gambling rounds of Red Dragon Inn with these nifty Gambling In/Out cards, featuring Pooky on the "In" side and the Wench on the "Out" side of the card. These were given out as an organized play prize.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew
The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl

boardgame.name: Final Fantasy XIV: Endwalker
boardgame.description:
Yet shadowed by their triumph in the First, the Warrior of Light and Scions of the Seventh Dawn are home at last. An even greater calamity than refulgent oblivion has been building in their absence, however─a second advent of the Final Days. Should all despair, the myriad conflicts that now ravage the land cannot but foretoken an end to life in the Source.

Take heart in the faith of those who walk beside you, and journey ever higher─to the very stars above.


New jobs: Sage and Reaper
A new playable race: male Viera
Level cap increase from 80 to 90
New cities: Old Sharlayan and Radz-at-Han
Travel to expansive new areas, including Labyrinthos, Thavnair, Garlemald, and Mare Lamentorum
New tribes to encounter: Loporrits and the Arkasodara
New threats to overcome, including Anima and the Magus Sisters
New dungeons
A new high-difficulty raid: Pandæmonium
A new alliance raid series: Myths of the Realm
New Small-scale PvP Content
An additional Trust ally: Estinien Wyrmblood
A new residential district: Ishgard
Updates to the Gold Saucer
Relaxing fun in Island Sanctuary
New gear and crafting recipes
A new data center: Oceania
Expanded horizons via the Data Center Travel System


Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Winner
2021 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn

boardgame.name: Way of the Gatekeeper
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A monastic traditions of spellcasting monks who teleport around the battlefield and conjure extraplanar creatures to fight for them.

boardgame.name: Vossa Excelência: Expansão Projeto de Poder
boardgame.description:
Vossa Excelência: Expansão Projeto de Poder (Your Excellency: The Power Project Expansion) is an expansion to the base game and will now support 3 more players! Additional rules introduce new game modes and guarantees huge replayability. It requires the base game in order to play.

Adds 45 new cards:


6 Politician cards
6 Party cards
12 parliamentary cards
6 Infamy cards
8 Electoral cards
1 Mayor card
6 Rules cards that introduce new game modes

boardgame.name: Monastic Tradition: Way of the Shadow Sun
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Monks of the Shadow Sun follow a philosophy of balance between light and darkness. They embrace rather than deny their own base impulses, exploring their inner demons and bringing them into the light. By accepting darkness as part of their soul, the monks of the Shadow Sun achieve a profound understanding of self. This allows them to harness dark energies to drain a foe’s life and convert that energy into light.

boardgame.name: Vossa Excelência: Expansão Calamidade Pública
boardgame.description:
The world has plunged into a pandemic. Fear, economic ruin, and death are everywhere. Governments are opening their coffers and implementing emergency measures against the virus. And what does all this mean for Your Excellency?
It's time to make money, A LOT of money.

Vossa Excelência: Expansão Calamidade Pública (Your Excellency: Public Calamity Expansion) is a standalone expansion that can be played alone or in conjunction with Your Excellency – The Political Game and its other expansions. In this expansion, you assume the role of a newly-elected federal deputy who needs to take advantage of the perfect storm of a pandemic to gather support, voters and (lots of) money, thus ensuring his permanence in power.

Can be played alone (for 1 to 3 players) or combined with the other products in the series.

Includes 60 cards:


3 Politician cards
3 Party cards
13 Supporter cards
16 Maneuvers cards
7 Event cards
10 Electorate cards
8 Infamy cards
15 money markers
1 dice
1 instruction sheet

boardgame.name: SCP: The Tabletop Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Operating clandestine and worldwide, the Foundation operates beyond jurisdiction, empowered and entrusted by every major national government with the task of containing anomalous objects, entities, and phenomena. These anomalies pose a significant threat to global security by threatening either physical or psychological harm.

The Foundation operates to maintain normalcy, so that the worldwide civilian population can live and go on with their daily lives without fear, mistrust, or doubt in their personal beliefs, and to maintain human independence from extraterrestrial, extradimensional, and other extranormal influence.

Our mission is three-fold:

Secure
The Foundation secures anomalies with the goal of preventing them from falling into the hands of civilian or rival agencies, through extensive observation and surveillance and by acting to intercept such anomalies at the earliest opportunity.

Contain
The Foundation contains anomalies with the goal of preventing their influence or effects from spreading, by either relocating, concealing, or dismantling such anomalies or by suppressing or preventing public dissemination of knowledge thereof.

Protect
The Foundation protects humanity from the effects of such anomalies as well as the anomalies themselves until such time that they are either fully understood or new theories of science can be devised based on their properties and behavior. The Foundation may also neutralize or destroy anomalies as an option of last resort, if they are determined to be too dangerous to be contained.

boardgame.name: Mage & Warrior
boardgame.description:
The Combined 2nd Edition of AGS-F1: Mage and AGS-C1: Warrior

From the introduction:

0.1 Introduction the combined 2nd Edition

Mage (1980) and Warrior (1981) were designed to provide generic role playing systems which were simple, easy to play, fun, comprehensive and realistic at the same time. The evolution of the role- playing hobby since this first edition has seen the rise and fall of many systems, games, and approaches to what is essentially improvised theatre. One of the ideas of Mage & Warrior is not having any restrictive character classes. A player can role-play anyone at all: someone who can do many things or is only good at only a few things. What is available will depend on opportunity, player choice and the amount of time available to learn skills.

The difference between a mage and other occupations lies in the amount of time required to acquire magical skills. A fighter can practice magic, be a thief, a cleric or anything else the player wished.

One of the things which has changed since the early days is the time available to set up a campaign and play a session. Players and GMs now avoid-in-depth systems due to lack of time and the difficulty in getting others up to speed.

This edition of Mage & Warrior continues the tradition of no character classes. There are new skills added to the original lists. We have simplified the approach to both magic and combat.

In these 2nd Edition rules we retain the view of the 1st edition that there is very little distinction between what is done by mages and what is done by clerics. Being a cleric who does miracles is being a kind of mage. What other differences there are depend on the power of the god or gods invoked by a cleric. Nothing in Mage & Warrior prevents a cleric from being a warrior, using all of the weapons of a warrior. Clerics are not bound by any rule not to spill blood or not to use swords. What causes clerics not to be warriors is the amount of time needed to become an expert in miracles.

0.2 Introduction to Mage (1980)

Magic is the stuff out of which all fantasy comes. If magic is not assumed, there can be no fantasy - no strange creatures, terrible monsters, demons, powerful swords or great wizards. Magic has traditionally been conceived as both an ART and a SCIENCE. It is an art insofar as its effects are not totally predictable and depend upon the will of the individual mage to come about. Magic is nothing more than the direct and successful imposition of the will on a part of the world bringing about a desired effect. It is also a science in the sense of being organised according to certain laws and principles such as formulae, rituals and spells.

0.3 Introduction to Warrior (1981)

Hand to hand personal combat is one of the mainstays of role-playing games. The other is, of course, magic whose presence in a game makes it a fantasy role-playing game. Hand to hand combat adds spice and excitement to any role-playing game since it offers the dangerous possibility of the player’s persona getting eliminated. In other systems, the simulation of hand to hand combat has tended to be either too simplistic, requiring no though or player input - mere dice rolling - or it has been too complex, requiring the player to engage in a great deal of bookkeeping and calculation as well as many die rolls. The present rules, hopefully, have eliminated most if not all of these problems and allow for a combat simulation with but minimal bookkeeping and most of the time only one die roll per incident. Warrior contains rules for simulating personal combat in the period between 500 CE and 1500 CE. This period begins with the advent on the European continent of the heavy horsemen of the barbarians and ends just prior to the rapier and dagger era. Warrior can be used both as an historical simulation or as a fantasy role-playing game as the player wishes.

boardgame.name: Ikki Tousen (F 1.0)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“In the span of 1800 years…the spirits of the dead have not found solace.”

Welcome to Earth... or perhaps we should say, welcome back to Earth. Before you rush to any conclusions however, we’ll clarify – this isn’t the Earth that you may have come from…though many places will look familiar. The year is 1992, and anomalies have been cropping up all over the Tokyo area. Kids have been showing up with “memories of the past”, the only common point between them being special jewels called the magatama.

You don’t need to investigate into this of course – there’s nothing binding you to this place, but you should at least be informed that there isn’t too much going on elsewhere at the moment. Before you go ahead and decide what to do with your time here there are still more preparations to make.

boardgame.name: Star Wars - Darth Plagueis JumpChain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away there was a man known publicly as Hego Damask II, an unlikely plutocrat that acquired great wealth and influence in spite of his disadvantageous parentage. His spindly reach is destined to remake this galaxy over the next few decades, for while to most he is merely a successful financier, he possesses a second, rather less known identity – that of Darth Plagueis, Dark Lord of the Sith. Born with powers far beyond all but a fortunate few in this galaxy, he was sired to continue the legacy of the Sith Order and spent many decades of his life apprenticed to Darth Tenebrous, cultivating his gift and developing an obsession with immortality and the source of the abilities shared by himself, his recently deceased master and those of the Jedi Order.

boardgame.name: LOWBORN: Zweihander RPG Fanzine (Issue 4)
boardgame.description:
Lowborn is the quarterly Zweihänder fanzine. Issue four contains a great mix of articles from spells, to new taints of chaos and encounters and tons of things for GMs to work into their own games.

This issue offers:


Magick Duels
Chimeric Weapons
New Ancestry: Awakened Undead
New Taints of Chaos
Sailing Professions
Perilous Tactics: Bog Behemoth
Perusing the Ivory Archive: Transmutation, Necromancy, Sorcery

boardgame.name: Parrotdigm
boardgame.description: In the trick-taking game Parrotdigm, a new scoring condition is revealed each round, with the points sometimes being positive, sometimes negative. Try to play your hand right to end up on top!

listing.notes:
In the Parrotdigm, the way you score varies in every round. The situation won't flow as expected. You have to do your best in every round to get a good score!
Product information
Language : Kr, En (separately, Cards have language) Publisher : Gameology Game Condition : NEW Availability : New Availability

boardgame.name: Ambershyft
boardgame.description:
Ambershyft is a 2-6 player cooperative game.
This game features a unique enemies turn into resources loot system.


when you kill blue enemies, you flip their tiles over, and they become ammo.
when you kill green enemies, they turn into movement.
when you kill amber colored enemies, they turn into energy.
when you kill earth colored enemies, they turn into health.


Bounties are how you get upgrades, how enemies spawn, and how enemies become stronger. You must work together to collect bounties before they expire.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Doktor Snuggles: Kvartettspel
boardgame.description: This card game contains eight families with four cards in each family. Each turn a player asks another player if he/she has one particular card. If the other player has that card he/she has to give it away to the one asking for it. Then the player can continue asking for cards. If a player don´t have the card you asking for, the turn go over to the other player. When you have all cards from one family you can put it down in front of you. The goal of the game is to collect as many sets of families as possible. The game is based on the character Doctor Snuggels created by Jeffrey O'Kelly.

boardgame.name: The Solstice Chasteners
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Fanatical and bloodthirsty, the Solstice Chasteners roam the land around the time of the winter solstice, punishing heretics and infidels among the people, in the name of the Twin Basilisks. For their blind devotion, they deserve no less than to be cursed by their beloved masters, with the very tool of their craft...

A monster and cursed item for Mörk Borg, in the holiday spirit.

boardgame.name: Putrid Gourmet
boardgame.description: A Mörk Borg class.

boardgame.name: Das Expedition Natur Spiel
boardgame.description:
Explore nature, actually at any time of year, but best from April to October. Properly dressed and well equipped, take order cards, explorer badges and ink pads. The players form teams and draw three order cards per round. Then they all try to complete their missions quickly and correctly and bring them to headquarters. If they succeed, they get a stamp point in their explorer badge. For each order, you have to present a found object; for orange orders, you have to show or describe exactly where it was found. In case of doubt, the game leader decides. The team that collects eight stamp points first wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die bunte Bande
boardgame.description:
Own circles should be connected by different colorful shapes.

Each player has four circles of one color - blue, pink, gray and yellow-green. One circle of each player is placed in the center together with the circle of the other players so that these circles touch each other, so to speak, form a square. The remaining circles are laid out in a circle around this center square with about a hand's width between them; there should be space between the circles and circles of the same color should not be directly adjacent or too close together. The 36 shape cards in six colors - yellow, orange, blue, purple, dark green and red - are laid out in an unordered pile, with each shape once per color.

The active player rolls the dice and takes any shape card of that color and places it on the table so that it touches a circle or another already existing shape card. If there is no matching shape card left in the supply, take any card of that color from the table and place it somewhere else. In this way, each player tries to be the first to connect his own circles with shape cards. The player who succeeds first is the immediate winner.

Cheerful, colorful, simple and an enjoyable, loose practice of spatial imagination and use of space; for example, you can put the fish and the starfish mouth to tip, or put the head of the gobbler in the crook of the starfish or mushroom - so you can overcome long distances, or avoid making it too easy for the other players to connect their own circles faster.

boardgame.name: Corners of the Earth
Corners of the Earth: Dawn Edition
boardgame.description:
2-4 players try to gain points over four rounds of play. This is achieved by playing cards overlapping “Corner” cards on the play area to balance habitats. Players may gain a bonus on their turn when their personal habitat is in majority.

A card is played and a new drawn each turn to gain points on the habitat track. Once a player reaches the 16th point on the track, the round ends. After the fourth round, the player with the greatest score from all rounds is the winner.

The game comes with 60 domino style cards and 5 pawns while fitting in a portable poker tuck box. The original version was published on The Game Crafter in 2020 with different art, packaging, and did not include cards to keep score.

boardgame.name: Lingering Hues
boardgame.description:
Abner and Hazelponi Hue must stop the Kimriyr before they reach the tombs of Naphal in this game of survival. This is a solo dice game in which victory is achieved by rolling dice to equal an enemies K.O. Points.

Getting past 12 enemies,(fewer for easier difficulty) will ensure victory. This is achieved with the aid of abilities and traits to provide re-rolls. The game includes eye catching dice and plastic flame token for tracking.

On a player's turn, a hand card is played and a new card drawn. With each card played, the enemy movement markers moves a step. When the marker is moved off the last mark, the enemy is encountered. All six dice are rolled in an encounter in an attempt to match the K.O. Value. The game ends when the player loses all capacity points or finished the last encounter with at least one capacity point remaining.

Changes from the 2015 edition include:
Tthe 16 custom candle dice concept in the 2015 version is removed. The new version has six standard dice and uses three tracking cards.

Movement is no longer tracked by cards, rather tracked with a token.

A main character had 1 ability in the 2015 version while the new version has 8 to purchase and use by playing cards.

boardgame.name: Local Traditions
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The year is 1910 and you and your friends have decided to spend a long summer weekend away from the city. So, you hopped on a bus to the isolated town of Burnsley;

a picturesque pastoral town surrounded by miles of stunning moorland where everyone is polite and wishes everybody they pass a "Good Day!" because everyone knows everyone ‘round these parts.

As beautiful and pleasant as the town may seem, there’s something not quite right with this place that you just can’t seem to put a finger on, ah well it’s probably nothing and there’s talk of a “Happening” on Sunday night, that should be good fun, right?

Wrong.

“The Happening” is a local tradition that may or may not involve something mundane like a violent ritualistic sacrifice or perhaps something more supernatural, like the invocation of a demon.

Shame the bus doesn't come back until Monday morning.

Your only objective is to work out what’s going to happen and avoid becoming victims to the town's strange folk tradition.

boardgame.name: Kalandozoo Marci az állatkertben
boardgame.description:
In this game you visit the zoo with the class. The teacher aunt gives the task of looking at what animals during the trip. The player in his turn can spend 3 actions to move on a board, observe animals, or buy. Observed animals (collect token) and expected items can score points at the end of the game. After 16 rounds, the zoo closes and the game is over. Whoever collects the most points wins.

In addition to the basic game, the toy box also contains 5 additional modules - The Lost Baby, Animal Feeding, Aunt Teacher, Shower, Bus

boardgame.name: Virusalarm in Bleibhausen
boardgame.description:
It is a beautiful spring day when two people return from their skiing holiday in the 100-inhabitant town of Bleibhausen. What neither of them know: They contracted the new NOSO virus (STILL SO a virus) while on vacation! Only after three days of incubation do they feel sick and stay at home. But how many residents have the two infected meanwhile unnoticed?
Can a major virus outbreak still be prevented?

Virusalarm in Bleibhausen is a free game for children and adolescents from the age of 12 that was developed with scientists from IST Austria and the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Biology. By reenacting the spread of a fictional virus in a city, players will explore and understand what countermeasures can take to contain viruses. In the Home Edition for the home, the players slip into the role of scientists ( game variants “simulation” and “vaccination ”), or into the role of politicians who have to weigh the advantages and disadvantages of restrictions on public life ( game variant “Challenge ” ).

Chips symbolize people, yellow ones are sick, white ones are still healthy. They are distributed in different buildings on a game board that depicts the fictional city of Bleibhausen. If there are white chips with yellow ones in a building, e.g. the restaurant, they become infected and turn yellow.

Players try to minimise the spread and earn points depending on how well they control the disease. The player/team with the most points, wins.

Es ist ein schöner Frühlingstag, als im 100-Einwohner Städtchen Bleibhausen zwei Leute vom Skiurlaub zurückkommen. Was die beiden nicht wissen: Sie haben sich im Urlaub mit dem neuen NOSO-Virus (NOch SO ein Virus) angesteckt! Erst nach drei Tagen Inkubationszeit fühlen sie sich krank und bleiben zuhause. Aber wie viele Einwohner_innen haben die beiden inzwischen schon unbemerkt angesteckt?
Ist ein großer Virenausbruch noch zu verhindern?

boardgame.name: Whispers from Wavering Hills
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Wavering Hills Sanatorium, a hospital for the relief of suffering lies nestled in central Kentucky on grounds with a sordid and mysterious past. The apparent suicide of a troubled young girl yields questions of an otherworldly nature. Will the investigators unravel the mystery of Wavering Hills?

boardgame.name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Dungeons Dark – The Rescue: Part 2
boardgame.description:
The quest that began in Across the Wastes continues in Dungeons Dark!

This new mission includes 4 scenarios that use a classic dungeon-style set-up. The rangers must explore the labyrinthine corridors and rooms of the dungeon, fighting monsters, dodging traps, and perhaps even finding a bit of treasure, in their bid to escape the dungeon and continue with their quest. The book also includes an extra scenario, should the rangers get captured, and a section on ‘shadow magic’, which the heroes can employ at their peril.

A Mission for Level 10+ Rangers

boardgame.name: Firm With Brownies: Shokai Training!
ファームウィズブラウニーズ 商会研修！
boardgame.description:
This is an expansion set for the Firm with Brownies (basic set) that has been set in the fantasy world. Basic set is required to play This set includes rules for one player game that allows players to become a sharp, merchant player to learn more about their creation, sales and their friends Brownies. Go ahead and start training with Brownies for business meetings. With this product, all additional cards can also be used for basic game sets. Number of players: 1 to 4 players; Play time: 30 minutes and up.

New cards include locations: Trading Post, General Store, Wheat farm, Furniture Shop. Four "Player Action" cards are included, which can be used to indicate when you've used your main action, making it easier to keep track of your turn.

boardgame.name: The Strange Merchant
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

With this supplement to the solo roleplaying game 'Colostle', you will be able to introduce a new recurring character, new fantastical gadgets and weapons, and of course new powers to wield.

boardgame.name: Rome: Rising Empires
boardgame.description:
"Rome: Rising Empires" This is a Roman themed board game with fun combat and an extensive variety of units to choose from, both on land and sea. There are Coins, Forts, Roads, Unit Tokens, Empire Boards, Trackers, Info Boards, Empire Markers, Generals, Commanders, Engineers, Inventions, Battle Boards and a huge Map with 45 sea zones and 127 land territories for you to wage war on.

The scenario in the game is set before Rome grew into the dominant force (circa 219 BC) and it will be up to you as a Player, to become the largest and most powerful empire in the Mediterranean. The rising empires of Rome, Carthage, Ptolemaic, Seleucid, Antigonid and Germania will go to war and determine who will conquer or fall.

The game is print and play, enjoy!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Nerves (Issue 1 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

Table of Contents


Romani Representation - Rue Dickey
A Forest of Our Own Making - Maria Mison
Identity in Roleplaying - L Wilson
Character Snapshots - Kyle Tam
Autobiography Comic Strips - Sam Pender
Power Fantasies in RPGs - Sharang Biswas
The Ritual of Summoning Ghosts - Seb Pines
History of the Satanic Panic - Bethany Loy
Jared's Unannounced Article - Jared Sinclair
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Behind the Masks: Who We Were at the Gaming Table
A Forest of Our Own Making
Toward a Definition of Game: Two Propositions & Their Antecedents

boardgame.name: Paul Koenig's The Bulge Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Paul Koenig’s The Bulge is a system containing seven separate competitive introductory level wargames covering the German 1944 winter offensive known as “The Battle of the Bulge.” As a special bonus, it also includes the German May 1940 attack upon Sedan against the French army.

This Deluxe Edition is an expansion to Paul Koenig's THE BULGE 6th Panzer Army, first published by VPG. It includes the following scenarios ...

5th Panzer Army - SE section of map
6th Panzer Army - NE section of map
7th Army Extension
​The Combined Game (5 & 6 PZA)
The Campaign Game - entire map (16 December to 26 December 1944)
Army Group B 1944 - NW section of map (23 December to 26 December 1944)
Army group A 1940 - SW section of map (11 May to 15 May 1940)

Each scenario has its own Exclusive Rules while each uses the same Standard Rules.

The design of these games is loosely based upon Paul Koenig’s D-Day and Market Garden series.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Paul Koenig's The Bulge: 6th Panzer Army

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Trailblazers
boardgame.description:
Trailblazers are the gutsy folks who pave and brave the trails of the great outdoors.  Whether by hiking boots, cycling wheels, or river paddle, these tenacious travelers seek to feed their insatiable appetite for adventure.  With a scenic wilderness ever ahead and a freshly charted path upon the heels, one mustn’t forget to eventually find their way back to camp.  For there are always new environments to explore, further expeditions to undertake, and more trails to blaze.

In Trailblazers, players compete to earn the most points by building biking, hiking, and kayaking loops from their campsites of the matching trail type. Each round, players are dealt eight trail cards where they’ll draft two cards, arrange those cards in their personal area, and pass their hand to the next player three times. Cards must either be placed adjacent to or overlapping other cards. While players can push their luck by aiming to construct long and elaborate trails, only closed loops that start and end at a matching campsite will score points. Players also compete to fulfill “First To” and “End Game” goal cards. After four rounds, the game ends and the player with the most points from closed loops and goal cards wins.

The standard edition of Trailblazers features a second deck of trail & player cards so you can play with up to 8 players. The box also contains two expansions (the Animals expansion and Adventurers expansion) that add another challenging layer of strategy and objectives to the experience. Finally, there are three unique solo modes that utilize the goal cards, Animals expansion, or Adventurers expansion.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Dice
boardgame.description:
The old king lies dead in a gambling hall, just two gems left in the coffers. Bandits wait on the borders, ready to strike. The farms and mines have fallen silent. You must rebuild the kingdom before the borders fall! All you have left to lose is a pair of dice. Save the failing kingdom you've inherited in this print-and-play roll and write game. You must rebuild the kingdom by constructing new farms and mines, investing in technologies and funding adventures, all before the kingdom inevitably falls again.

Made during the 2020 worldwide Covid-19 quarantine. Print out a few copies and play with the people you're isolating with, or hop on a chat and play a remote game with friends.

—description from the publisher

In this game, you will roll two dice and use their results to mark attacks, production, buildings (farms and mines), technologies, and adventurers in the game sheet.

The game ends when any player marks all the attacks on a single border of the realm or all his/her mines as built. Finish the current round, then tally scores. The player with most victory points wins.

boardgame.name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge 2
boardgame.description:
You are locked up by a genius, with no hope of release, are you…? He'll let you go if you can prove you're worth it! Show that you can remain calm under pressure. Solve as many puzzles as possible within 10 minutes; only then do you have a chance of surviving this… Play alone or in a team and unravel the riddles under time pressure, while the seconds tick away.

There are 48 riddles to solve, with an encoder included to check your answers.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

boardgame.name: Moon Dragon Summer
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Summer doesn't know what to do; her mother just wants her to get married and settle down, even though Summer owns the only weapon that can slay the dragon terrorizing their home.

boardgame.name: Lady of the Winds
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Your stepfather doesn't understand what a free spirit you are, and when he tries to sell your beloved horse for dowry money, you run away from home to make your own destiny.

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 5 - Jul 1998)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez - Juegos de rol
No 5

Julio de 1998

boardgame.name: Mushrooms and Malfunctions: A Journey into the Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In The Caverns of Ever-Ticking, mechanical dangers stir. In this adventure, characters must brave the wilderness of this fey realm to retrieve what has been taken—but can they survive the oddities that await them?

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st - 4th level characters and is optimized for five characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure.

This adventure begins in the town of Noanar’s Hold, before transitioning into the realm of the Lord of Stopped Clocks, The Caverns of Ever-Ticking..

CONTENT WARNING: substances (alcohol, mention), possible phobia triggers (insects, snakes).
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: RPZine (Issue 1 - 2021)
Tusseltop Grotto
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hex Dungeon 1 - Tussletop Grotto - a solo RPG dungeon crawl for Virtual Tabletops.

This issue features the full base game of Hex Dungeon and the first dungeon crawl, Tussletop Grotto. Medwen needs heroes! The Dragon Throne war has been lost and the servants of Hexmaster, Zoranda Fulcrum, now sweep unchecked across the kingdom. King Uthred and the people of Hammerfall remain protected behind the impenetrable walls of the capital city, but the forces of Fulcrum fast approach. The days of humanity are numbered.

You are Medwen's only hope. The Hexmaster hides in his lair in the depths of the Icepick Mountains, defended by magical traps and the best of his guardians. But a lone assassin could sneak into the dungeon and deliver justice if only the dungeon's location could be ascertained and its magical wards bypassed. If Fulcrum dies, his hex magic will die with him and his minions will abandon their rampage.

You are the chosen assassin, but before you can take down Fulcrum and save Medwen from certain destruction, you must deal with the Hexmaster's dungeon lords - each a cog in the evil sorceror's war machine. Each dungeon lord, master of their own subterranean lair, possesses one of the ward keys you'll need to disable Fulcrum's defences and throw open his secret headquarters.

The first of the dungeon lords is Genetra, Queen of the Wyverns, whose lair is the legendary grotto beneath Tussletop Hills. Long has her location been known to the sages of Hammerfall and so here your quest will begin. Enter Genetra's dungeon, eradicate her guardians and face her in a final battle. Her ward key must be found and her power must be broken in order to buy time for the beleagured city of the king.

boardgame.name: RPZine (Issue 2 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Featured in this issue: Bug Hunt is a high octane, one-session wonder virtual tabletop RPG inspired by a certain movie franchise that shall remain nameless for copyright reasons.

Contact has been lost with the remote mining colony on Yertis8. It's probably nothing, but just in case, the capital ship Naberius, carrying an alpha team of uncompromising soldiers armed to the teeth with every conceivable weapon known to man, has been deployed to investigate.

Your mission is simple. Find the highly paid and important scitecs known to be working on [REDACTED] at Yertis8 and bring them home safe and sound. Don't waste too much time worrying about the colonists. Do Not Break Anything. Yertis8 has a significant dollar value and arbitrary thermonuclear explosions will not be tolerated.

Designed to be fun, but also terrifying, we wrote Bug Hunt as a Christmas one-off. Ideal for an entertaining evening session of three to four hours max and three to 6 players ideally (not including the GM).

boardgame.name: RPZine (Issue 3 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Three RPG concepts designed to inspire and get your creative juices flowing.

PASCAL'S DICE

A creative RPG idea based on the mathematical strangeness of Pascal's Triangle.

D6-D6

A low-mechanic high-freeform RPG system using only two d6.

ONE PAGE RP

A fantasy RPG system condensed into one visually fun page.

boardgame.name: RPZine (Issue 4 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Battle Royale, Squid Games and I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here, Drome is a visually intense virtual tabletop one-shot described by one playtester as 'the epitome of gaslighting'.

The tone is tongue-in-cheek, the puzzles are mind-boggling.

Life is a daily trial. You exist on the bare minimum, toiling in a labour mill by day and re-education factories by night, with only four hours allocated to sleep. Home is an unfurnished, windowless, 10x10 room. Breakfast and dinner is boiled rice and black beans. You sleep alone on a concrete slab and barely speak to another soul from one day to the next. Rest is for the innocent and, as nobody is innocent, nobody rests. Although, strangely, the higher echelons do seem to enjoy this luxury.

Drome is your only outlet from the exhausting tedium. This tri-monthly telly-viz event is broadcast straight into your domicile. You sit on the floor (you have no furniture) and wait eagerly as the screen starts to flicker and buzz. You enjoy the puzzles. You enjoy the comeradery of the contestants. Not so much the exploding heads.

Selection is a dream few will realise. Those who win don't just go free, they go into the higher echelons! Vacations, mattresses, food and, the ultimate reward - permission to engage in relationships, maybe even procreate! Failure means death, but death is no worse than labour. At least the dead get to rest.

boardgame.name: RPZine (Issue 5 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
RPZine Issue 5 - Halloween Special - EVP

This issue features a classic solo-play CYOA style paranormal ghost hunting investigation in the Ghost Adventures milieu. Solve the haunt using gadgets, investigative techniques and a puzzle-solving approach.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 16)
boardgame.description:
This is issue No. 16 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: A Cemetery in the Fog
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Cemetery in the Fog.

Your players will have the opportunity to descend into the depths, meet ghouls or worse in the center of an underground lake...

boardgame.name: An Old Country Farm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for An old Country Farm.

It is time to move deeper into the country. The people here look at you strangely. Their accent is very pronounced... And you will have to gain their trust to advance in your investigation...

Here is a farmland, inhabited or abandoned. In autumn, spring or very bad weather. There is also a cellar and an attic.

boardgame.name: A Shrine under the Sea
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Shrine under the Sea.

Your investigators got the coordinates of a small island lost in the middle of the ocean. It seems to be uninhabited, except for some crabs... But its depths may reveal something unusual...

The island is proposed in "tropical" and "northern" versions.

boardgame.name: A Country Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Country Village.

Your investigators can investigate a whole village. They have access to several houses, the church, the police station, the inn, the store, the garage and a small bar. During the night a mysterious seismic tremor revealed an abyssal fault... This adds to the strange disappearances of the region...

The map exists in day, night, fog, insane weather version, and with or without the rift.

boardgame.name: A City Police Station
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A City Police Station.

Your investigators can now investigate with the police themselves, be interrogated, be incarcerated. And also something terrible happens, a mysterious flood washes away everything in its path...

The police station is set in an environment corresponding to a large American, European or Middle Eastern city, there is a special version with the Arkham crest.

boardgame.name: A Riad in the Desert
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Riad in the Desert.

Your investigators can now travel to the desert, meet Berbers, powerful sorcerers from Egypt, or simply solve a murder that took place in this jewel of the sands...

There is a lot of versions for this Riad (GF/1F) : Day/Night, Classic, Desert, Oasis, Cotton Fields, with or without Murder in the pool. And a sandstorm version!

boardgame.name: An Industrial Harbor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for An Industrial Harbor.

Your investigators can now talk to the captains and sailors who can barely stand. The place is not a good one. The local bar offers beer, bad wine, and all the gossip of this unsanitary area. There is a small merchant ship at the dock, which knows what's in its holds.

There is a lot of versions for this Harbor : Day/Night, Fog/Fog night, Insane Weather, Roof or Roofless... And yes! The boat is usable on the open sea!

boardgame.name: A Museum of Natural History
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Museum of natural History.

Your investigators can now gain knowledge, in history or archaeology, by talking to eminent professors. It's often said that the Tyrannosaurus was the earth's largest predator, but a trip to the basement will reveal that this is not quite true. And oh, the strange thing that was recently brought into the museum... came out!

For these versions : Day/Night/Insane Weather, and an access to the basement and the shielded room.

boardgame.name: A Medina in the Desert
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Medina in the Desert.

Your investigators come across a place in the desert.
They will be able to rest after several days of walking, under a blazing sun. Of course there is a market, but above all a sacred place, where precious relics are kept... But when the sun goes down, the place is attacked by looters or worse... Should we escape by the roofs or fight?

For these versions : Day, Night, Under Attack, and Hole Version, for GF and 1F!

boardgame.name: An Hostel on the Beach
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for An Hostel on the Beach.

Your investigators think they're going to have a great time on a beautiful azure colored beach... But everything does not go as planned. I don't know if it's the lobster, or the noise outside, but they will have trouble sleeping. Deep Ones will leave footprints in the sand. And to celebrate the twentieth map, the great Cthulhu will appear! Good luck!

Several versions are available depending on the subscription tier: Day, Night, Insane Weather, Deep Ones traces, Cthulhu Shadow. There is a Ground floor, a 1st floor, and a roof version (in full map or just Token).

And finally: the beach exists in tropical and northern climate.

boardgame.name: A Lobster Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find in this pack a large content of (grid and gridless) Maps for A Lobster Factory.

Your investigators will want to go to this cannery, which produces lobster juice for the whole region. And they will do it with a handkerchief on their nose! They will meet an authoritarian boss, strange employees, with prominent eye sockets, and a crushed nose. Their skin oozes a kind of sweat that looks like sea water, and some of it probably ends up in those damned cans...

boardgame.name: Halloween - Freakshow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You will find a map for Halloween (grid and gridless) : Halloween - Freakshow.

You can try to collect poor clues thanks to the fortune teller or against an arm wrestle with Mr. Muscle.

boardgame.name: That Will Do
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What happens when you cross inbred hill folk with missionaries of the New God? Weird pig creatures of course! In this entry of the Unspeakable Things series, Júlio Rocha presents a shocking and delightful illustration and Schwalb himself wraps words around it, forming a soft and sweet nest in which it can do all its hog things. In other words, "That Will Do" offers a thin slice of disgusting, strange, and unhinged writing with which you can vex your Shadow of the Demon Lord gang!

boardgame.name: The Crimson Gold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Crimson Gold is a five part adventure designed for a party of four from level 8 to level 13. It is a direct sequel to The Fallen Crown, but can also be run standalone.

Jeziblan is at peace once more. The great city-state has had its government restored after a turbulent week, but as it opens up something is amiss. Suddenly vendors are flooded with a strange tinted coin, which appears to be solid gold save for the strange hue it turns when held up to sunlight. It is suddenly unclear whether or not the gold should be accepted, and as the Market begins to turn on itself, Guildmaster Serina Versidonia hires the party to figure out where the gold is coming from and whether it should be accepted. The coins do not appear counterfeit, exactly; in all respects but one, the reflected red hue, they appear authentic, if too freshly minted to be in circulation for long. Is infernal interference to blame?

boardgame.name: Blood Feud
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Role-Playing Game about Honor, Power and Toxic Masculinity

Blood Feud is a game about toxic masculinity: certain common attitudes and behaviors among men, that cause great harm to them and to others around them. This is a game about people being nasty to each other and about figuring out why.

It’s also a game about vikings of pre-christian Scandinavia; about honor and blood feuds, courage and brutality, corruption and consequences. Above all it is a game about what it means to be a man in such a world—and what consequences that has on the communities they live in.

The goal of the game is to explore and experience toxic masculinity, while at the same time creating a thoughtful drama about relationships, competition and social consequences. With this game we want to make toxic masculinity easier to spot for a wider variety of people in our roleplaying communities—and encourage critical discussions about how men behave, and why.

boardgame.name: We Are Coming, Nineveh!
boardgame.description:
We Are Coming, Nineveh! is a tactical/operational-level game of the Iraqi government campaign to liberate the western area of the city of Mosul from the forces of Daesh between 19 February and 9 July 2017. This was one of the largest and most difficult urban operations of the post-WWII era, and marked a major defeat for Daesh and its so-called “Islamic State.” The game is thus able to combine low complexity (and hence be accessible to even neophyte wargamers) with a rich and detailed treatment of this important battle.

Unlike most wargames where there is a single measure for victory or loss, We Are Coming, Nineveh assesses three key aspects of the campaign: the speed at which the operation is completed, the casualties suffered by Iraqi government forces, and the collateral damage done to Mosul. One might outperform the historical case, capturing the Old City faster—but at a terrible civilian cost.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Conflicts against the Islamic State

boardgame.name: Lanzerath Ridge
boardgame.description:
Lanzerath Ridge is a solitaire wargame that takes places on the first day of the Battle of the Bulge, during the Second World War. In the game, you take control of a small group of American soldiers. Under your command, the Americans must fend off the relentless attacks from German paratroopers and fusiliers. Your goal is to recreate the incredible historic accomplishment of the American soldiers by defending the town of Lanzerath, Belgium and delaying the advance of an entire SS Panzer Division.

Lanzerath Ridge is the next design in the Valiant Defense series, following the critically acclaimed Pavlov's House, Castle Itter, and Soldiers in Postmen's Uniforms. The Valiant Defense series allows you to play amazing stories of courage, with small forces holding the line against unimaginable odds. Games in the series focus on the individual defenders and are deeply rooted in history, while providing a quick play experience with a light complexity rule set.

Lanzerath Ridge is divided into four attack periods, each of which is represented by a deck of enemy cards. Each attack period is divided into a number of turns, and each turn consists of two phases:

The game ends immediately if the defenders’ morale drops to 0 or if a German attacker takes over an American defensive position. Otherwise, the game ends after the last attack. Your level of success is based on the Americans’ morale, intelligence gained during the defense, and any objectives you accomplish.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: WATO (What Are The Odds...)
boardgame.description:
The game of What are the Odds where you don't need to think about what scenario of odds to give your friends next.

We're not saying your going of friends is boring, but, we're saying it takes a little bit more effort to create an unforgettable night. So, that's why we've come up with 130 ridiculous scenarios that will embarrass everyone one card a time and you'll find yourself belly laughing on the ground not caring that someone just pee'd there.

The game goes a little something like this:

Person A picks up from the deck and reads the card aloud to everyone "What are the Odds?" Person B (The person to their right aka righty) chooses the odds to make this between. This cannot be any higher than 10 or any lower than 2. The closer to 10, the less chance of the odds being chosen. The closer to 2, the more change of the odds being chosen because yeah...it's a one in two chance.

Person A & B think of a number between those odds set by Person B. Everyone counts 3,2,1....then at the same time Person A & Person B say the number they were thinking between those odds given.

If they say the same number, then Person B must do the task for the points or risk loosing points. If they don't say the same number, then it moves on to Person B pulling a card and reading it to Person C. (or back to Person A if you are playing with 2 people)

The name of the game is to get the most points and win. You decide on how many points that is as a group before starting.

boardgame.name: Take a Seat
boardgame.description:
It's première day, where the best musicals of the city compete to fill theaters for weeks on end. To make your première is the most successful, you will need to attract and sit the audience onto the best possible locations. This will not be an easy job. The word got round and the most important celebrities, authorities and press do not want to miss this glamorous event. Will you be able to find the best seats? Now if you'll excuse me, the "Show must go on!"

PLAYING THE GAME

Take a Seat introduces an innovative mechanic named Share & Write where the randomness is created by player interaction (instead of a dice or a card). In each turn players will get a reservation panel and they will have to decide whether to use the usher's ability or get direct points. Then they will need to mark a reservation in the board of their right or left (depending the turn) by scratching on any of the 4 tickets of the reservation panel. Finally they will have to assign seats on the theater by marking the outline and the circles that correspond to the selected pieces in the previous step.

The game last 14 turns. Once ended you proceed to the final score. There are 3 areas to score: objective cards, reservation majorities and usher bonus. Players add up all points to get the total scoring. The player with the highest score wins the game

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring – Battle in Balin's Tomb
boardgame.description:
The game takes place over 12 rounds, with one player assuming the role of the Goblins of Moria and the other that of the Fellowship of the Ring.

Turns begin with the Goblin player drawing the number of Goblin cards shown in the rulebook and placing any additional Goblin reinforcements (and possibly the Cave Troll as well) in the appropriate positions, then each miniature can move and attack or attack and move or pass the shift; the Goblin player performs these actions with all of his miniatures and once he has none left, the Fellowship player can finally activate his characters.
Once the movements and attacks have been made with all the miniatures in play, the turn ends and the next turn goes on.

At the end of the 12 game turns the Fellowship player wins if he has at least three characters left alive including Frodo; if instead Frodo is killed but the Fellowship player still has at least 3 characters still alive the result of the game is a tie, while if there are less than 3 Fellowship players alive, the Goblin player wins.
