boardgame.name: Backflip!
boardgame.description:
This solo game has the shortest rules ever written. The goal of the game is written on the title: Backflip!

During his turn, the player throws the eraser in order to do a backflip with it. If the eraser does a full rotation and it lands showing a smile on the face, he wins. If the player fails to complete a full rotation with the eraser or doesn't land showing a smile on the face, he loses.

boardgame.name: UNO: Minions – The Rise of Gru
boardgame.description:
UNO with Minions theme, but with a special rule that let's you strike a pose in the game.

There is a card called the Wild Dumb Fu card. If you play it, the next player in line skips their turn. Instead they have to hold a martial art pose until the next time, their turns comes on. If they move before it's their turn, they have to draw 4 cards. It also is a wild card so when you play it, you can choose the color to resume in play.

boardgame.name: Chasse au mot!
Woordrace
Wörter!
boardgame.description:
Throw 13 dice with different letters on them. Then when the hourglass starts you try to make a crossword of words that give you the most points.

Each letter has a point value. Total up your points for each word. the player who has the most points at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #22)
boardgame.description:
From website:

Welcome to the December 2021 issue of the Glatisant!


Knave Knews
Reviews
Plants and Herbalism
Art
Theory and Advice
Worldbuilding
Rules and Game Design
Interviews

boardgame.name: Monster Mash Collection #3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third installment of Monster Mash collection. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover new creatures known as Shadow Ray, Zorbo, Krasy Kat, Stone Wolf, Dread Allip, Death Horse, Death Knight, Skeletal Lord, Skeletal Orc, Skeletal Wolf, Skeletal Wraith These creatures will add a new dimension to your Fantasy Hero campaigns.

These creatures range in size, power, and abilities. The creatures will challenge adventurers in many ways. Adventurers need a challenge and these creatures will challenge them.

boardgame.name: Upload 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D.s is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full time job to try and keep track of them as well as update information about the, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This collection contains a bookmarked PDF and Hero Designer Files containing the following previously S.I.D.s Report Supplements:

S.I.D.s Report 18 – CLOWN, S.I.D.s Report 19 – White Queen, SIDs Bulletin #10 – Killer Bee

boardgame.name: Minions of Resurrection
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if coming back from the dead isn’t just an incantation or a ritualistic spell which returns the soul back into its mortal shell? What if those actions and words are merely a summoning ritual? A calling to some greater power, in the desperate hope that it might intervene.

“Minions of Resurrection” is a 16 page, RPG agnostic resurrection system which provides extra flavour to bringing Players back from the dead.

Featuring:

An explanation of how the deals work
Random Minion table
28 different deals for coming back to life

boardgame.name: In the Heart the Land of the Wizard of Oz
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Heart of Oz contains procedural Encounter, Terrain and Weather Engines for Wilderness Hex Crawling across the fairy-tale like land of Oz. There is also a procedural 'dungeon' to take on the Wicked Witch of the West in her Yellow Castle.

ItHoOz uses a 'Hex Flower' mechanic to generate these setting features.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #7)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this seventh issue:

Spells & Upcasting for Infinity's Edge, for those who don't have the Virtual Grimoire!
The Three Kingdoms, Part 3, part of the new setting for Infinity's Edge!
New Heritages for Thunderscape TinyD6... the Florrans!
Introducing Nationality Traits for Thunderscape TinyD6!
Legacies of the Silver Age for Tiny Legacies, so your character can carry the torch!
In Tiny Legacies' Random Heroes series, meet Broadhead, the defender of Port Aldea!

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #8)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this eighth issue:

For Infinity's Edge, learn the secrets of the Shorefall Thieves' Guild!
Continue exploring the Three Kingdoms in Part 4 of the new setting for Infinity's Edge!
We learn more about the new Nationality Traits for Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Thunderscape TinyD6, explore the savage city of Vochny, bastion of strength!
Who are the Primordials? Learn about these cosmic beings from the Legacy Universe!
In Random Heroes, we meet Kaiju, a tragic, horrifying hero for Tiny Legacies!

boardgame.name: Ludnica na tribinama
boardgame.description:
Each player is a seating manager making sure his part of the stands is filled with happy spectators. On his turn a player adds a new spectator to his hand, then chooses to place any from his hand on his board. By fulfilling their seating preferences he scores public and private objectives. The game ends when one of the stands is filled. The player with the most points wins.

Name in English: Show on the Stands.

listing.notes:
Payment is possible with Revolut, PayPal, or a bank transfer.
Please ask for shipping :)

boardgame.name: Lunatic Asylum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the lunatic asylums in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Forbidden Knowledge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behind the walls of the caravansary, guarded by professionals, you can finally relax a bit. The Inn is reputed to have training facilities for warriors, fine food, and soft beds. All are welcome… And nearby are rumored to be hidden secrets of the ancients along with valuable treasures.

Hidden Knowledge can be used as an adventure in any campaign world, or played as a sandbox in Hellebarde's default setting. Written and tested with Castles and Crusades RPG, notes are provided for conversion to other OSR systems.

Forbidden Knowledge can be used stand-alone or as part of the Exterris Adventure Tome AT-5 (AT-5 plus ONA-17 through ONA-20).

boardgame.name: Voyager Space Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 5 features The Voyager Space Station, a planned toroid ring space hotel, planned for construction in orbit in 2026. Voyager will spin gently providing gravity equivalent to the moon while it orbits at 17,000 kmh at 500 km from the ground.

Inside you’ll find how the technology works in real life, plus 3 foresight scenarios predicting the development of the technology, hyperlinked throughout to important information, like:

Have astronauts had sex in space?
Can you burp in microgravity?
What happens when you die in a vacuum?
Issue 5 also includes 7 settings for your games;

Casino Orbital - Can your disavowed group of spies prevent enemy agents from crashing the world's first live televised orbital poker tournament into the Earth? A techno-thriller setting ready to blast off.
The Daedalus Incident - In space stations everyone can hear you scream! Advice on running Sci-fi horror in orbit.
The Sky & the Sea - When an abandoned space station's orbit decays and it crashes into the sea a group of marine divers set out to loot it.
Pirates of the Kármán Line and the Curse of the Black Swirl - A routine space-walk on an orbital tin-can goes horribly wrong when pirates attack. Can Clara make it back inside in time to save her crew? A setting and short story.
La Noire Époque - In this apocalyptic setting international tensions lead to nuclear war, leaving the residents of the Aditi Nivaas space hotel to survive as the last spark of humanity.
The Heavenly Raj - Welcome to the Chakra, a ring of palatial space stations surrounding Earth where bejeweled Rajas and Ranis are served by the inhuman bioengineered naukar, but will there be a rebellion in heaven?
Calhoun's Folly - Join the archeological expedition to explore the last great space-station, Calhoun's Folly, a sealed commune of artists whose art became very dark before they went silent altogether.
And lots more, like:

Station Creation - 12 random tables to help you create your own space stations - millions of possible combinations, and an example creation; the Phoenix.
Imposter-syndrome: or how I learned to create chaos & love myself - Advice on running PC imposters and saboteurs in your game.
The Dilemma - A mini-game based on the Prisoner's Dilemma game theory, allowing large organisations like space stations to interact and conduct a Trade War. Will they choose mutual cooperation or sabotage and bloodshed?
With added crunch for using the technology in your games of:

5e D20
Fate
HexDNA, and
Apocalypse World (Powered by the Apocalypse)

boardgame.name: The Great Shadow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Great Shadow is an introductory adventure to the Trudvang Adventures, giving you a taste of the setting and the game.

When three children are kidnapped from River's End, a small village in Dain, the locals ask the player characters to help them find them. Their investigation might lead them to the Great Shadow.

This module is designed for 4-6 level 1 characters. You do not need anything more than this module to enjoy the story, but if you wish to enjoy Trudvang Adventures to the fullest, make sure you get the Trudvang Adventures Hero Companion and Trudvang Adventures Setting Companion. It should take 1 or 2 sessions to play through the module.

boardgame.name: The Elementalist Class for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elementalists are arcane casters that cast spells based on air, fire, water, and earth. While elementalists have fewer utility spells they make terrifying battle mages and are perfect for underground or underwater adventures. Included in this document is the following:

Elementalist character class
Aeromancer, Pyromancer, Geomancer, and Hydromancer class specializations.
Spells
New magic items

boardgame.name: Campfire Tales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Campfire Tales is the twenty first in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the second in our Series Four series of zupplements, each detailing monstrous goodness.

Inside, you'll find:

The first Lana short in a while. It's called #iHateCamping. I think it's funny.
Legends and myths from the California woods and mountains. Six new monsters with stories attached.
Rangers, a new hunter kink that specializes in hunting monsters in the great outdoors.
Cryptogeography, featuring a few points of interest in the mysterious Bear Pines National Park.

boardgame.name: Big-Bobby-Car-Sicher im Verkehr
boardgame.description:
Traffic education with Big Bobby Car.

Each character starts in house A or B. The car and road cards are divided into two piles. Everyone tries to get to school or kindergarten as quickly and safely as possible.

The first player answers a question about the traffic cards - if the answer is correct, you roll the dice and move on. You stop on a red field (road crossing!). The road can be crossed in the next turn with "green" of the traffic light dice. Unsecured crossings can only be crossed by revealing a free street. With a crossing guard you cross the street with a 4, 5 or 6.

The first player to reach their destination, wins.

boardgame.name: Fragments of the Past Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Everything needed to start playing Fragments of the Past, including:
- an introduction to the lore of Fragments of the Past;
- the complete rule-set;
- a ready to play Adventure-Tragedy, "The Destiny of the Moray Eels-City";
- four playable characters with their character sheets;
- over 40 illustrations.

boardgame.name: Pana Po'o
boardgame.description:
Party game in which you have to guess the concept that your partner tries to capture with the pieces of different shapes that come in the game. A challenge to the imagination.

One player in each team, picks a tile with a concept. Then they roll the die an then try to construct the shape using the same color tiles for their partner to guess before the sand timer runs out. A successful guess scores a point. At the end of the third round, the winner is the one who has guessed the most words. and the team with the most points when the tiles are completed, wins.

boardgame.name: Fragments of the Past - Narrative Artbook
boardgame.description:
Fragments of the Past – Narrative Artbook is a collection of myths, drawings, artifacts, poems, and stories from the ancient continent of Askedoria.

For Players and Storytellers of the Roleplaying Game, it will be a source of inspiration and a treasure trove of information to experience even more intensely the fiery world surrounded by the Ophiotaurus Ocean.

The Narrative Artbook of Fragments of the Past is a book to get lost in, a journey into a lost past that could have been and was not.

Inside, the reader will find:
- A geographical description of Askedoria, the ancestral uses, and customs of Iskuzai and Etoi.
- Numerous artifacts and talismans related to the cult of the Twelve Gods.
- Myths dedicated to Six of the Twelve Immortals: from the divine Phoeraia to the Twin Moons, the Green-Faced Goddesses.
- The impious story of the tragic loves of the Prince-Mercenary Diosconis and the Oracle-Concubine Tumsilt of the Celestial Nomads.
- Over 40 illustrations.

boardgame.name: Würfelschlange
boardgame.description:
The game contains 7 different, very simple dice games. It's mostly about achieving certain dice combinations first or with the fewest rolls. Since the individual games are played with up to 13 dice, it is advantageous to recognize combinations or patterns.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Conquest
boardgame.description:
In Conquest, players alternate turns placing an influence chip on a space adjacent to 3 or 4 cards, and then moving their marker to the next numbered space. One player starts on the 1 space, then moves to the 2, 3, and so on; the other player starts on the 18, then moves to the 17, 16, and so on.

The game ends after 17 turns. The player with the most chips adjacent to a card wins that card, which is worth the printed number of points.

Some cards have special abilities; for instance, in a player wins the 1, 2, and 3 cards, they achieve an auto-victory. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: "Frösi"-Denkspiel
boardgame.description:
Each player has 8 pawns and 20 tokens of the same color. Taking turns the players place one pawn unto the gray spaces on the game board. Whenever a player places the 4th pawn around a scoring space, he puts a token on this space and scores the number of points indicated there. When all pawns have been placed on the board the moving phase starts. The pawns may move one apace in any direction or jump over any other pawn to a free space behind this pawn, trying to encircle more scoring spaces. Only 1 jump is allowed per turn.
When all scoring spaces are covered with tokens, the meeples have to reach the home spaces of their color. The game ends, when the first player has reached all 8 home spaces. Each pawn on a home space scores 3 points. The Player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: nana
나나
boardgame.description:
nana is a card game where players are looking for 3 of a kind. Players are required to sort the cards in their hand in numerical order.

On your turn, choose any single card to reveal - either the low or high card from a player's hand (including yourself), or any face down card from the table. Then, do it again. If the two cards show the same number, continue your turn; if they do not, return the cards to where they came from and your turn is over.

If you are able to reveal 3 cards showing the same number, take these as a set in front of you.

The first player to collect 3 sets wins, but there are a few ways to earn a victory with less sets as well.

boardgame.name: Couch Skeletons
boardgame.description:
These spooky sassy skeletons are looking for a couch to crash on. Compete to knock your opponent's skeletons off the couch in this quick and easy two player game. Once you've filled the couch with you own skeletons you can declare yourself victorious.

Players take turns placing numbered skeleton cards onto 1 of 5 couch spaces until one player has covered the couch with their skeletons. That player is the winner.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Jurassic Park Edition
boardgame.description: Secure dinosaur paddocks and other areas but beware of the T. Rex; it doesn't follow rules! Build fences to protect paddocks from the attack and earn money by charging rent, but prepare for damaged property. Activate the gate to hear the Jurassic Park movie theme song or a dinosaur roar, which will determine how much money to collect. The last player with money when all others have gone bankrupt wins. The game also ends if the T. Rex damages all properties before they can be protected with fences or repaired. Then everyone loses!

boardgame.name: Först till skatten!
boardgame.description:
A roll and move game where you roll the dice and move your game piece every round. If you end up on a red ring, read the instruction in the speech bubble and follow it. The player who comes first to the treasure chest in the cave wins. But watch out for the troll on the way there.

The game was included in Semic´'s "Barnens Jultidning" in 1978.

boardgame.name: Reager's Return
boardgame.description:
Reager's Return is the second game of the Blackbrim Series, the sequel to Blackbrim: 1876.

It has been a year since your run-in with the devious criminal Reager Skinner. Since then, there have been no new leads. You begin to accept that the trail has turned cold until a letter from the London Police arrives, asking for your help against Reager in the capital. Letter in hand, you board the next available train, though something feels amiss...

Reager's Return contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of puzzles to decipher and clues to crack.

--description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 6 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this sixth issue of The Gnoll Sage, Fleabag details out the time they ran into the inspiring Commander class! Bringing leadership into the combat arena.

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 7 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this seventh issue of The Gnoll Sage, Fleabag educates us on the ecology of the owlbear, as well as the several owlbear variants: alphabear, undead owlbear, hummingbear, stuffed owlbear, snowy owlbear, eaglebear, and lizardbear!

boardgame.name: Dieties & Domains: The Watcher Pantheon (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a cleric enthusiast looking for fresh domain spell options and powers? Or a GM that has created your own world and needs a unique pantheon to give it flavor...

This supplement puts a unique pantheon in your hands along with 11 new cleric domains, including Affliction, Communication, Dawn, Discovery, Hunting, Metamorphosis, Phantoms, Seduction, Shepherd, Wanderlust, and Woodlands. Learn about the clergy, temples, taboos, and philosophies of the deities that make up The Watcher Pantheon.

Guidelines and a step-by-step approach to creating your own pantheon are also included!

boardgame.name: Dieties & Domains: The Watcher Pantheon (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a cleric enthusiast looking for fresh domain spell options and powers? Or a GM that has created your own world and needs a unique pantheon to give it flavor...
This supplement puts a entire new pantheon in your hands. It can function completely independently of other pantheons or exist simultaneously alongside established pantheons. With 40 completely new domains, there is also extensive information about the clergy, temples, taboos, and philosophies of the deities that make up The Watcher Pantheon.

Guidelines and a step-by-step approach to creating your own pantheon are also included!

boardgame.name: Yukon Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frozen north hides gold… and Elder Gods.

Yukon Dark is a setting supplement for Tiny Cthulhu that explores the 1890s Klondike Gold Rush, a time when many flocked North to find their fortune but found horror instead. This setting guide includes details of a sample mining boomtown called Porte Blanche, new additions to the Tiny Cthulhu mythos, and pre-generated characters (created and played by the cast of the Yukon Dark live-play). It even has suggestions for how to play with dynamite!

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Outdoor Sports Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Winter Season Promo 2021 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order at their webstore.

Outdoor Sports

It's a project card with a cost of 8 M€. It has no tags.

Requirements: At least one city from any player adjacent to at least one ocean.

Effect: Raise your M€-production by 2
1 VP

Promo card X38

boardgame.name: Nuts! Compendium
boardgame.description:
The Nuts! Compendium - the perfect compliment to Nuts!. With Nuts! and Nuts! Compendium you can play any battle in WWII from anywhere and any time. Two books, that's all you need.

The Compendium contains a series of rules that can enhance and customize your NUTS games and campaigns, allowing you to run scenarios from the blazing hot deserts of North Africa to the frozen steppes of Russia.

We’ve gathered the rules from all the supplements and scenario books and brought them together in one place. Inside you'll find:


Updated Character and figure rules, including new Nuts! Attributes and morale levels like Plucky and Fanatic.
Privation, fatigue and Out of Supply rules for when your games get tough.
Cavalry combat.
Boat combat and amphibious landings.
Night fighting.
Rules for Airborne assaults, Ski troops, K-9 teams and Engineers.
Enhanced artillery and air strike rules.
Additional Chocolate & Cigarette lite RPG rules and attributes such as Wheeling & Dealing and Shell Shock.
Optional vehicle rules, including multi-turreted tanks, top armor attacks, bogging and getting tracked.
New terrain, weather and environment rules including Desert, Jungle, Alpine and Urban.
Additional mission and campaign rules.

boardgame.name: Gift game: Nic nie ukryjesz
boardgame.description:
Pointing fingers is usually considered rude, but it's downright obligatory in this game!

One player reads the question, everyone counts down to three, and selects the person they think best fits the description. All players who fall into the majority group win a card. The first player to accumulate 5 cards wins the entire game.


Wskazywanie palcami jest zwykle uważane za niegrzeczne, ale w tej grze jest wręcz obowiązkowe!Jeden z graczy odczytuje pytanie, wszyscy odliczają do trzech i wskazują osobę, która według nich najlepiej pasuje do opisu. Wszyscy gracze, którzy znajdą się w grupie większościowej, wygrywają kartę. Pierwszy zawodnik, który zgromadzi 5 kart, wygrywa całą rozgrywkę.

boardgame.name: Zabójczo wciągające: Śledztwo
boardgame.description:
Zabójczo wciągające: Śledztwo is a party card game in which you can witness, compose a crime story or solve puzzles as part of the investigative team! Each role is equally important and each role is guaranteed to be fun! Feel the atmosphere and emotions of criminal puzzles while playing with your friends. Who will find the right track first, solve the mystery and be the winner?

The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

The game ends when one of the players correctly guesses the story made up by the one who draw the card.


Śledztwo to towarzyska gra karciana, w której możesz być świadkiem, układać historię zbrodni lub rozwiązywać zagadki jako członek zespołu śledczych! Każda rola jest równie ważna i każda gwarantuje świetną zabawę! Poczuj klimat i emocje kryminalnych zagadek podczas rozgrywek ze znajomymi. Kto pierwszy wpadnie na prawidłowy trop, rozwiąże zagadkę i okaże się zwycięzcą?Gracze muszą odgadnąć zbrodnię, pytając, zgadując i bawiąc się.

Gra kończy się, gdy jeden z graczy poprawnie odgadnie historię wymyśloną przez tego, który dobrał kartę.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne Anniversary edition draw bag
boardgame.description: A draw bag produced in the anniversary edition artwork.

boardgame.name: Manthrak's Malicious Steamroller
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After an experiment with a teapot goes wrong, a wizard's tower rolls through the forest, crushing all beneath it. Its owner, Manthrak the Meticulous wants it back. It's up to you and your companions to stop the tower's rampage before something even worse happens.

Manthrak’s Malicious Steamroller is a short, high-octane one-shot adventure module for a party of four or five 4th level characters. With no setting specific details, it can be easily dropped into any campaign, or run on by itself for an action-packed escapade.

boardgame.name: New Rules for Tiny Characters
Rules for Playing Tiny Characters in 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creatures that occupy a space less than 2 1/2′ x 2 1/2′ are Tiny in 5th Edition and deserve some love! Now you can play Tiny characters and truly know what it feels like to overcome impossible odds.

No one likes finding a bear wandering through their cucumber patch, especially when that bear towers over you like a mountain! Being tiny is perfect for having a debate with a chipmunk, but puts you at a serious disadvantage against the vast array of large hostile creatures in the world.

The Alwaysgreen Forest is full of tiny creatures. When playing a tiny creature one must keep in mind the impact of battling and moving around creatures that may be much larger and in many cases, much stronger.

boardgame.name: New Subclasses: Vine Walker Rogue - Order of Rot Wizard
Seeds of Decay: New Subclasses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Swing through the trees as a brutal assassin, the Vine Walker Rogue or harness the energy that lies in between life and death as an Order of Rot Wizard.

Vine Walker Roguish Archetype
There is something about them, the way they grow, and climb, and grasp. They can be delicate and bright with life; or old and thick, relentlessly stubborn. They spring from the ground when you’re not looking to choke out your garden. They spread from earth to leaf to tree, connecting an ever growing, suffocating web. Vines are a perfect assassin.

Order of Rot Arcane Tradition
The essence of magic permeates both life and death. As the circle of life, death and decay progresses, a unique form of magic is released by the decay. There is a certain tranquility you gain by understanding the cycle of life. The closer you draw to it, the more you hunger for it. It is from the decay that your life thrives. It is in between death and life that you find power.

boardgame.name: New Options for Playing Forest Animals: The Woodkin
Player Options for Forest Animals in 5e: The Woodkin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New options for playing Forest Creatures in 5th Edition. Includes several new racial options and a unique system for creating your own animals!

The great Blue River flows through and around the Prime Tree. The first tree of the forest provides life to these flowing currents, often with unpredictable results. One quality is known; the water gives intelligence and understanding to many forest creatures that otherwise would not have it. These are known as Woodkin.

How the Blue River’s water chooses which creatures gain knowledge and understanding is not known. Nor do they know why some trees that grow along its banks suddenly uproot, gaining the ability to walk and talk. What is known is that woodkin are just as much a part of Dobberton as the Dobbers themselves.

boardgame.name: Gevaudan
boardgame.description:
GEVAUDAN is a first-person horror game. Alone against an enemy as deadly as it is terrifying, your nerves are put to a severe test as you try to make your way through the forest before the beast finds you. You cannot afford to make a single mistake.
The Game
The Beast of Gévaudan... The monster that bathed Gévaudan in terror in the 18th century, slaughtering the inhabitants. One hundred people are thought to have died in this part of France, victims of this deadly scourge.

What lay behind the legend of the monster of Gévaudan? A wild animal, divine punishment or a serial killer... Many are the hypotheses.

Whatever its true nature, you may well learn what it means to be a victim of "The Beast".

For you have entered the monster’s hunting grounds. You must keep your senses sharp and your wits about you if you are to withstand the scourge of GEVAUDAN. Can you make it out alive?
Key Features
Total immersion linked to the feeling of vulnerability.
You can only rely on instinct to reach the far end of the forest.
A visceral atmosphere.
Discover a 250-year old legend that still fascinates today.
For an optimum experience and to maximise your chances, use a headset to ensure you can hear danger approaching.

(From Steam)

boardgame.name: Red Riding Hood - Star Crossed Lovers
boardgame.description:
So you think you know all about the tale of Little Red Riding Hood? Well think again! Embark on a surprising adventure based loosely on the tale by Charles Perrault!

Red Riding Hood and the Werewolf have known each other for years and have since grown very close. They have even been having secret meetings in the forest!

But their relationship has not gone down well with the Werewolf clan! Adamant that he must prove his worth, his family orders the Werewolf to bring back a human prey who is none other than the sweet and pretty Red Riding Hood! He refuses to obey and decides to run far away with Red Riding Hood...

- Around 50 hidden anecdotes relating to the tale
- Use the Werewolf's special sight to discover other hidden objects
- Visit enchanting scenes during the day and at night
- Rediscover Red Riding Hood in an adventure with an original storyline
- Several challenges, including hidden objects, puzzles and riddles
- Built-in zoom function
- Rechargeable clues
- An engrossing soundtrack
- A nail-biting adventure big on humor
- Colorful characters
- A fantasy tale where worlds collide

(From Steam)

boardgame.name: Occultus - Mediterranean Cabal
boardgame.description:
Sicily, early 1900s…

The grandson of a renowned antique store owner arrives in Palermo to visit his grandfather. When he gets to the city, he discovers his grandfather's store has been vandalized and that the old man has disappeared.
On the ground, he finds a troubling note about a midnight Mass to be held that very same evening. The young man decides to follow this lead, plunging him into a most mysterious quest...

Dive into the heart of an unbelievable investigation set against stunning Italian backdrops. Make your way through the many hidden object scenes and solve the increasingly original puzzles. Your time is limited, so warm up those gray cells!


Stunning hidden object scenes
A wide variety of minigames and enigmas
Explore the beautiful backdrops of early 20th-century Italy
Alternate day and night scenes
Intriguing characters at the heart of a quest into the underground world


(From Steam)

boardgame.name: Fedora Noir
boardgame.description:
Fedora Noir is a collaborative role-playing game of corruption, loyalty, passion, and betrayal, told in the style of a film noir.

How far will the Detective go to solve the case? Can the Partner and the Flame be trusted? And what will the Hat think when it all goes sideways?

Designed for a quick and easy start, and featuring a chapter structure that guides you through the arc of a classic detective movie, you can begin your game in minutes and tell a unique story each time you play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: KILLWAGER
boardgame.description:
Killwager is an extremely tactical, small-unit based, realism focused Ultramodern and Near future tabletop game. Minimal tokens, full on narrative. It takes you from the modern day to a newly colonized planet 80 years into the future. The only consistencies? Cash and Violence..

Lead a hard team of near future mercenaries as they do the bidding of several powers in the area. Blazing a corpse soaked trail of glory, cash, and spent casings across intense "End of the movie" style direct action engagements.

During their turn, a player has one model perform (or two if they are within 4"), which consists of moving, shooting, taking cover, interacting with terrain, and many other measures. Any model performing can be targeted by a reactive measure. Moving across the battlefield can give your opponent an opportunity to stun, or eliminate outright, your moving asset. It's very simple and breaks down into individual actions with no math. Only increasing difficulty in performing your actions. No more adding 2 or three different modifiers together. Just one flat target number to roll a D10 and add your single stat to. That's right. One stat for the entire game

A game of Killwager can end in multiple ways. Typically, you want to get the most objective points, and exfiltrate off the battlefield, while trying to deny your opponent the same outcome. However, one player can be forced to end their play time prematurely if they hit pullout conditions specific during a scenario. Often times this is having too many assets killed. Once pullout conditions are met, a player must move all of their forces off the board edge or face capture by their opponent or death at the hands of 3rd party AI.

A player wins when points are counted up after a scenario or a chain of scenarios. Capturing objectives matter on the battlefield, and count towards your overall score. However, losing assets, including very important ones, or accidentally eliminating non-hostiles, will give you negative points. So even if you have the most people alive at the end of a match, you might not be the winner.

boardgame.name: A Complicated Profession
boardgame.description:
A Complicated Profession is a collaborative storytelling TTRPG. You’ll create your crew of former bounty hunters, then start a new career hosting intergalactic cruises.

This is a GM-less game for 3 to 5 players, intended to be played over 1 or 2 sessions of 3 to 4 hours.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: I'm Sure You're All Wondering Why I've Gathered You Here This Evening
boardgame.description:
I’m Sure You’re All Wondering Why I’ve Gathered You Here This Evening is a roleplaying game where players find themselves trapped in a mansion playing a deadly game where only one will emerge alive. That lucky winner will inherit the vast riches of The Deceased; a wealthy eccentric that all the guests know somehow.

The game usually plays out over the course of 1 evening (around
3 hours). But, of course, your group can roleplay as long as they want!

Players will each draw cards that tell a bit about the guests they’ll be inhabiting during the evening. After the guests have been introduced, the players will each add details of who The Deceased was in life.

Next, the players will all take turns exploring the mansion. Players might talk to other guests, hunt for objects in the mansion, or get to cutting down their competition.

This premise is a dark one, but we invite you to treat the game as a melodramatic, farcical play in which everyone is over-acting and silly.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.rpg: I'm Sure You're All Wondering Why I've Gathered You Here This Evening

boardgame.name: Beano The Board Game
boardgame.description:
It is an average day in the school yard when you decide that it is time to play some pranks.

Players take turns to journey around Beano town and try to prank the different locations whilst avoiding the teacher. Perhaps you will drop a whoopee cushion at Mount Beano or splat custard pie at Bunkerton Castle. Will you be the first player to prank six different locations and win the game?

—description from the designer

Players each hold a hand of Prank cards, and take turns to roll dice to move their chosen character across the map, landing on spaces on which the they must perform the associated action. Idea cards detailing a location and prank are collected along the way, and when a player has a matching combination of Idea and Prank, they can head to the specified location to perform the prank, banking the Idea card.

The Teacher piece is moved throughout the game and acts to bar your way across the board.

The winner is the first player to bank 6 idea cards.

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Warband & the Dreadful Horde
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The characters playbooks offer very concise and focused ways to explore and enjoy the traditional classes. But what if you wanted more? What if you wished to explore the world and its dangers and dungeons with a different set of characters? Unique and powerful on their own way?

The Forgotten Warband & The Dreadful Horde brings eight new classes with inspirational artwork for your game. Bring destruction and avoid the perils of the Black Hack.

- Play as a Crusader, a mighty warrior that balances his martial prowess and his faith.
- Be an Eldritch, a cursed wizard bound to an abyssal monster.
- Conquer the wilderness as an Outlander, a trained explorer: lethal, brutal and precise
- Unleash the Brawler within, a powerful fighter that uses strikes and grappling to overcome his foes.
- Play as a the sneaky and treacherous Goblin Raider, poking everything with you trusty spear
- Be an Orc Warmaster, a feared and unstoppable warrior on the battlefield.
- Call forth the unruly magic as an Gnoll Shaman, a carnivorous and ritualistic magic peast
- Become one with the darkness as the Dark Elf Prowler, abandoned by the gods and magic.

It's time to take your group to the next level!

boardgame.name: Owl and Weasel (Issue 6 - Jul 1975)
boardgame.description:
Owl and Weasel
No. 6 - July 1975

the newsletter from games workshop 15 bolingbroke road london W14

Dungeons and Dragons

boardgame.name: ARC Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Combine your imagination with the power of dice rolls to build memorable stories about the apocalypse. Together with your friends, take on the role of humble heroes and embark on grand adventures to save the world — a world that you fill with secrets and omens.

boardgame.name: Vanishing the Lady
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The celebrated Zoe Grimalda, the most beloved woman in town, is sick and tired of being so darn beloved. She wants to escape Joquiet and needs your help to do it!

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Created as part of the Adventurer's League Dungeon Craft program. The fourth Adventure taking place in the original Domain of Joquiet.

CONTENT WARNING: Name dysphoria, soap opera twists, gaslighting, creepy doll, indentured servitude, haunted bathroom, implied cannibalism

boardgame.name: Paupers' Ladder: Bon-bons
boardgame.description:
First off, happy Christmas to you all!

This little print and play expansion adds the following to a game of Paupers' Ladder or The Moon Towers:

CRACKERS
Your Pauper will start the game with 3 Crackers. Some contain gifts, others tricks. Invite other players to pull a cracker with you when you occupy the same Region.

SPECIAL QUESTS
Each Pauper now comes with a Special Quest only they can complete. This contains updated versions of the Special Quests from the Christmas In Brighton expansion, plus Special Quests for all the Paupers from The Moon Towers and the Bodachs from The Brighthelm Bodachs.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Paupers' Ladder: The Bodachs of Brighthelm

boardgame.name: Lords of Vaala: Scourge of Valerna
boardgame.description:
Bring in 4 new FACTIONS along with their characters and unique Vaala decks; 2 generals and 2 dragons.
- Nahuac realm (Eirándi)
- Ysval realm (Oryan)
- Coatl dragon brood (Tetzcoatl)
- Exxor dragon brood (Rakzor)

This expansion can also increase player count up to 6 players (or replace other factions in games with 1-4 players to allow different combinations, maybe 4 dragons or 4 generals).

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lotniczy Biznes
boardgame.description:
In the Lotniczy Biznes game, we become the president of a new airline, it is an extremely hermetic market and it is difficult for us to "enter the showrooms", especially since other airlines are opening with us, and our friends become their CEOs!

For our lines, every round opens the possibility of making one flight, on which you can either earn or lose, in case few passengers use your line! To make such a flight you have to negotiate the price with other CEOs, whoever gives the most rolls the dice.

Before game starts players draw a card with their main airport, a 'special ability' card and get one aircraft. Players can upgrade their aircraft, take a loan, and bids on flying to a destination. The player who wins the auction rolls the dice to see if they've made a profit. The first player to collect a billion Euro wins the game.

How much and whether you earn on the connection made depends on several factors, such as the economy of your plane, what airport is your home base, random events such as damaged landing gear and especially on how many passengers will use your line! By managing risk well, wisely investing in modernizing your machines or rejecting unprofitable connections, you will develop your airline and achieve success in this hellishly difficult aviation business!

The expanded edition contains : +10 random event cards +2 starting airports cards (this means 7 players can play the game), +2 special ability cards (as above), +20 destination airports (60 vs 40, longer game), aircraft service fee (which you have to pay every round, depends on aircraft type), loans


W grze Lotniczy Biznes, stajemy się prezesem nowej linii lotniczej, jest to niezwykle hermetyczny rynek i ciężko Nam "wejść na salony", zwłaszcza, że razem z nami otwierają się inne linie lotnicze, a ich prezesami zostają Nasi znajomi!Światowe lotniska są coraz bardziej zatłoczone i coraz popularniejszy jest handel slotami na lotniskach, im popularniejsze lotnisko, tym więcej trzeba za taki slot zapłacić, jednak jest to okazja dla linii, ponieważ mogą oni podnieść cenę biletu oraz liczyć na większy zarobek! Najdroższą taką transakcją w historii, był zakup połączenia na Heathrow, American Airlines zapłaciło aż 60 milionów dolarów linii SAS, za ich miejsce!

Dla naszych linii co rundę otwiera się możliwość wykonania jednego połączenia, na którym możecie albo zarobić albo stracić, w przypadku gdy mało pasażerów skorzysta z Waszej linii! Aby wykonać taki lot musicie negocjować z innymi prezesami cenę, kto da najwięcej, rzuca kostką.

To ile i czy zarobicie na wykonanym połączeniu zależy od kilku czynników, takich jak ekonomiczność Waszego samolotu, to jakie lotnisko jest Waszym portem macierzystym, zdarzeń losowych takich jak uszkodzone podwozie! A zwłaszcza od tego, ilu pasażerów skorzysta z Waszej linii!

Dobrze zarządzając ryzykiem, mądrze inwestując w modernizacje swojej maszyny czy odrzucając nierentowne połączenia rozwiniecie swoją linie i osiągniecie sukces na tym piekielnie trudnym lotniczym biznesie!

Grę wygrywa gracz, który jako pierwszy zgromadzi miliard Euro.

boardgame.name: Пираты Голицына
boardgame.description:
This game was invented and drawn back in 1934! Its author is Vladimir Mikhailovich Golitsyn from the famous Golitsyn family. In his youth, he was a sailor and sailed in the northern seas. Later, the sea became the main theme of his work. This version of the game has been significantly improved and made in a new graphic design (by KoTdeSigN).

The game uses both currents and wind force and shallows with rocks. From 2 to 9 people can play at the same time.

The players are divided into 2 teams: the Spaniards, whose task is to transport gold from South America to their homeland. And the pirates, whose task is gold, respectively, to take away.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kapteeni Koukun Aarre
boardgame.description:
The goal of this Disney licensed game is the same as in basic memory that you have to find matching pairs around the board and who finds the most wins the game. Moving happens by rolling the dice and you can move any of the three characters on the board. You get to see the tile that you land on and one any other tile to see if they match. If they do you get to roll again. The game lasts until all pairs have been found. The player with the most pairs wins the game.

—user summary

Hälytys, hälytys! Kapteeni Koukku ei löydä aarrettaan. Liity kapteenin joukkoihin ja auta häntä löytämään kadonnut aarre. Merirosvojenkin muisti reistailee joskus, mutta ehkä sinä voit auttaa heitä. Kyllä he jonnekin tänne piilottivat sen, mutta minne? Pärjätäksesi tarvitset hieman onnea, hyvän muistin ja merirosvon oveluutta. Kaikki mukaan jännittävälle aarrejahdille!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Sea of Bones
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Unglorious: Sea of Bones è un’espansione per il gioco di ruolo necro-fantasy di Unglorious, contenente tutto il necessario per giocare nell’Era dei Filibossieri.

English translation:
Unglorious: Sea of ​​Bones is an expansion for the necro-fantasy role-playing game of Unglorious, containing everything you need to play in the Era of the Filibossieri.

boardgame.name: Bestiario delle Lande
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Nameless Land: Bestiario delle Lande è un'espansione per il gioco di ruolo post-apocalittico di Nameless Land che ti porterà faccia a faccia con tutti gli orrori che abitano le Lande del Nuovo Mondo.

English translation:
Nameless Land: Bestiary of the Lands is an expansion for the post-apocalyptic RPG of Nameless Land that will bring you face to face with all the horrors that inhabit the New World Lands.

boardgame.name: Belly of the Fishy Beast
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This adventure was modified specifically for use with Adventure Hour! but works with any adventure game you choose to use. This one-page dungeon works as a great introduction for new players! Delve into the corpse of a water-dwelling monster. Explore the depths. Encounter fish men. Avoid the squid man at all costs.

boardgame.name: The Dee Sanction: Adventures
boardgame.description:
Six adventures set against the backdrop of London and the Elizabethan countryside, setting Agents of Dee against varied conspiracies and devilish plans, filled with diverse challenges and dark magic.
(Source: Publisher's website)
Adventures included:
- Window of the Soul
- The Gong Scourer's Baby
- In Fertile Soil
- The Monk's Cowl
- The Harrowing of Harlow Hall
- Ex Libris
There are notes suggesting a campaign linking the adventures, previously published as standalones.
(User Summary)

boardgame.name: The Conquered Sun
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

It is the birth-feast of the Son. The entire town of Sanctus Clemens has turned out for the festivities, which center around the reading and re-enactment of the birth of the Son.

There’s just one problem: the child who is supposed to play the Son has gone missing, and the pageant begins at midnight! They were last seen playing around the temple — where could the child be?

The Conquered Sun is a one-page dungeon for OSR systems. The module is combat light and appropriate for early-level adventurers (levels 1-3).

boardgame.name: The Cave of the Yetis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #5 of Populated Hexes Monthly moves to the frozen north of Absalom, a thousand miles north of the Plains of Zelaia, and features an ice cave inhabited by cruel yetis. The issue also includes rules for exploring in the icy wastes, new equipment to help explorers survive, a new monster (the winter wight), the valuable alchemical substance known as spectral frost, and several new cold-themed spells.

boardgame.name: Diamond Races: Race Equity Variant Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diamond Races: Race Equity Variant Rules strives to bring all races into an equitable state. Our primary goal is to create a rules variant that allows for players to pick a race that fits their character concept, rather than feeling selection pressure from some of the very basic options offered by race.

So bring out your dwarven stone-bards, your elven berserkers, and your halfling fighters!

boardgame.name: Zoek's Short Adventures Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zoek the kobold sorcerer is an unfortunate character with a life full of misadventures and humiliations.
He, however, travelled all around the world and saw more wonderous and hidden places than anyone could ever desire.
Many adventurers followed his directions, and came back with unimaginable treasures!

Zoek's Short Adventures is a collection of seven one-page dungeons and adventures.
It is meant to provide concise but flexible material for DMs to include in their main stories or to be played in a single session.

boardgame.name: Bloody Harry
boardgame.description:
In this game inspired by the Harry Potter parody comic book, Your objective will be to win your house by earning as many victory points as possible. Collecting the lessons will be profitable for you but do not hesitate to use magic cards, because all the blows are allowed to grab the victory !!

You start the game with 5 magic cards in hand, the card of your house and its associated power and a number of school cards placed on the timetable, variable according to the number of players. On your turn, you perform 2 actions : Draw magic cards or collect a school card (at a variable cost depending on the number already in your possession). You can perform the same action twice. Do not hesitate to activate the effects of the school cards and play your magic cards in order to perfect your strategy, increase your score or, better yet, decrease that of other players by giving them bad points!
The game ends when a player has 10 school cards in front of him at the end of a turn. The winner is the one with the most victory points.

boardgame.name: Valerian's Trial
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In dark corridors a soft droning hum hints hidden mechanisms.
Smooth stone walls are chiseled with hypnotic patterns.
Floor tiles are carefully aligned with inhuman precision.
At the end of the trial a promise of knowledge and power.

Valerian’s Trial is a dungeon for 4 characters of level 10. This module can easily be integrated in your adventure or be used as a standalone dungeon. Players will face golems, deadly traps and the biggest challenge of the trial: discover the path to the last room.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 22
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 22 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Battle Cobra T/F/G/I/J/X
Doom Courser Prime/A/B/C/D
Night Gyr T/F/G/X
Goliath GOL-3M/3M2/7C/7K/7R
Jade Phoenix Prime/A/B/C/D/E
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Jurassic World: The Legacy of Isla Nublar
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Isla Nublar, where you and other scientists, dreamers, and schemers will build an attraction like no other. Take on the role of visionaries John Hammond and Simon Masrani, visiting scientists Dr. Alan Grant, Dr. Ellie Sattler and Dr. Ian Malcolm, sharp-minded park personnel Claire Dearing and Dr. Henry Wu, and many more, each playing a vital part in the island's legacy.

Together, you will transform Isla Nublar into an astonishing paradise where awe-struck visitors encounter creatures never before seen by human eyes. Decide where to build park facilities, dinosaur enclosures, and guest attractions — and keep employees and visitors safe from the mighty Tyrannosaurus Rex, colossal Brachiosaurus, clever Velociraptor, and other threats.

In Jurassic World: The Legacy of Isla Nublar, you play through twelve adventures in which you customize an entirely unique game board and breed new dinosaurs you cannot unmake. Your team's fateful choices will have a lasting impact, creating your own Isla Nublar story. Your experience will culminate in an endlessly replayable game of your own creation.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Betrayal: Santa & Minsc Promo
boardgame.description: This promotion is a reversible character card for Betrayal at House on the Hill and/or Betrayal at Baldur's Gate and adds Santa (Betrayal at House on the Hill) or Minsc, Beloved Ranger (Betrayal at Baldur's Gate) to the game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Betrayal at House on the Hill

boardgame.name: Sicher ist Sicher
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wine Rating Pocket
boardgame.description:
Wine Rating Pocket is a re-working of Wine RATING as a one or two player game. It is not possible to use two copies of Wine Rating Pocket to play Wine Rating. Whilst the gameplay is the same, the cards are changed in the Pocket game.

User summary
In the game of Wine Rating, you are a wine critic. You give a rating to wines from various countries, while investing in wineries to monopolize the market.

This game uses 4 investment tokens per player and 16 cards. On the table, there is a space to hold 16 cards in 4 x 4 square grid, and each row and column represents reputation of a winery in which players may invest. Each turn, you have two options: you may place a rating card, which ranges from -3 to +5, in the square grid, affecting two wineries; or you may place two investment tokens on any wineries.

At the end of the round, the investor on each winery takes the reputation score on that winery. After the third round, the investor calculates their total score.

Although the cards have Japanese text, you can play Wine Rating ignoring the text. There are two types of cards: winery cards and rating cards. Winery cards are written in English and Japanese, and all Japanese text on the Rating cards are just flavor. They gorgeously describes a wine in wine critics' comments. Japanese players can enjoy the text, but it is not necessary for gameplay.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Tink Camp
boardgame.description:
This add-on includes:


9 Miniatures: 1x Loot Tink, 4x Psycho Tinks, 4x Shotgun Tinks
All game cards needed to play
Bounty scenarios


-description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery

boardgame.name: Fit to Print
boardgame.description:
Fit to Print is a puzzly tile-laying game about breaking news, designed by Peter McPherson and set in a charming woodland world created by Ian O’Toole!

Thistleville is the world’s most bustling little town — it’s a challenge to keep up with everything going on, from who took home first prize for their baked goods at the community fair to who has been digging in Mrs. Brambleberry’s carrot patch.

As an editor at one of the local newspapers, your job is to tell their stories!

The front page is due in just a few hours and you have no time for perfection. Grab the big stories before the other papers get a chance, and make sure you get the right photos too. A newspaper is a business, so the money has to come from somewhere — don’t forget the ads! After you’ve picked out a combination of stories, photos, and ads, it’s time to lay out the front page. Did you take enough tiles to fill the paper, but not so many that things have to be cut? Over the course of three hectic days, your skills will be tested as you compete to be the most newsworthy editor!

Fit To Print is a tile-laying game for the whole family. Players simultaneously collect newspaper tiles, stacking them on their desks until they think they have what they need to make the perfect front page. Then, they will yell “Layout!” and begin to lay out the page by carefully considering the placement of centerpieces, articles, photographs, and advertisements. When everything is just right, they yell “Print” to be the first off the press and gain their choice of centerpiece for the next round! This hectic spatial puzzle features over 100 unique newspaper tiles, 6 characters with their own special abilities, as well as 3 decks of Breaking News cards — so that each and every time you play you will be solving a new puzzle!

If real-time games aren’t your style, Fit to Print has a number of alternative modes to satisfy every type of puzzle gamer. In Slo-Mode players take turns drafting tiles from a shared market and arranging them on their front pages. In Puzzle Mode, take a specific set of tiles and piece together the highest-scoring arrangements. Whether you enjoy relaxing solo puzzles on your own, or frenetic action for up to 6 players, you will have a blast helping the critters of Thistleville tell their stories!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Steve the Psycho
boardgame.description:
Contains:

Steve the Psycho miniature
boss, announcement, and other game cards
Battle for the Spotlight digital scenario
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery

boardgame.name: Wir wandern nach Halle
boardgame.description:
A number of dominoes are dealt to the players, who take turns adding dominoes to the display after the starting player has placed a domino on the table. If a player hasn't a matching domino to add, he has to take a domino from the stock. The first player who adds his last domino to the display has reached Halle and wins the game.

The dominoes show buildings, landscapes and hiking symbols.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lambda Dice
ΛICE
ラムダイス
boardgame.description:
ΛICE, a combination of the greek "Lamda" and "dice", is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players. The cards show the traditional suit and rank, but the illustration in the middle shows the card's rank made out of the sum of 1 or 2 die faces. In addition to playing a card to a trick, a player may also play a die. If they do, after everyone has played a card, the players who also chose to play dice roll them and choose one of the eligible places on their card to place the die; it could change the value of the card up or down. The card also becomes the color of the die.

Players earns points for hitting their bid of how many tricks they expected to win as well as tricks won and dice collected. The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Touchdown Heroes
boardgame.description:
Touchdown Heroes is a trick-taking game for two teams of 2 players that is loosely based on American football.

One team is the offense, and one is the defense. While the offense only gets three downs to make a touchdown, and there are multiple levels of touchdowns, the game does also include interceptions, punts, onside kicks, and other features of American football.

The lead for a trick chooses if the team will call a running play (a must-follow trick), a passing play (a may-follow trick), or a kick (which involves rolling a dice).

The game takes place over two halves, and the team with more points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Old World: Roll and Write
boardgame.description:
Old World - Role and Write is a tabletop roll and write game set in the fictional world of "old world".

The aim of the game is to get the most points by placing races from the old world into the most optimal parts of the land. Some races love the mountains, other dwell in the forest. Some need to live close by to each other to survive, others like to live in solitude.

The game was created as a free print and play to be downloaded over the holidays of 2021, with the aim of bringing people together.

boardgame.name: 絑々 (syusyu)
boardgame.description:
絑々 (syusyu) is a 2-player abstract strategy game from Japan (the theme is lipstick pieces).

At the start of the game, each player selects their six player pieces one by one. They have already received a card which restricts the placement of pieces, and so must select pieces from the pool to help their intended strategy. All pieces are visible to each player.

Then players take turns to place a piece on the grid board, such that the piece cannot be the same colour just payed, and they cannot break their own restriction card.

The player who cannot place a piece loses the game.

The game was launched at the Autumn 2021 Tokyo Game Market, with early reservations getting a special edition of pieces with little bows on them.
user summary

boardgame.name: Hush
boardgame.description:
On the other side of Earthshine, the evil spirits come out at night. They'll ravage anything in sight, as they feed on chaos and destruction. But you thrive for survival. Survival of yourself, your people, and your property, and ultimately, protecting the sacred creatures that you share the land with. You work hard to survive and you will not let the undead get in the way.

In Hush, 1+ players will work together to manage a group of commoners that are trying to survive the dangers of each passing night, and ultimately, protect the nocturnal creatures that live on the land. By day they will build resources, shelter, and develop techniques, and by night they will protect each other from the evil spirits that pass through. The goal is survival. How many nights can you make it before the spirits bring you down?

—description from the publisher


Starter Kit released for Board Game of the Month Club in March 2022.

6 monthly episodes released from March to August 2022 packages, that includes:

Map postcard
Character card
Nocturnal Creature card
Spirit card
Structure card (every other month)

boardgame.name: AdvanceQuest: Chaos in the Chasm
boardgame.description:
AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

A missing ambassador. A lost treaty. A strange asteroid. A deadly monster. You'll lead a team of gryphon raiders to investigate all of this (and more) in Chaos in the Chasm.

A new chapter in the AdvanceQuest story is coming.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

—description from the publisher


A solo micro-game designed by C.C. Chamberlin, based on Dungeon Hero. Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then start the adventure.

boardgame.name: The Royal Limited
boardgame.description:
The second of 2022 Scott Almes Simply Solo games is The Royal Limited, a hand management game of placing fancy train cars, loading them up with fancy passengers, and trying to leave on time. It'll also be our second Wes Anderson influenced game, if you couldn't already tell from the title and the logo.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dog Daze
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure TME-5 for The Mutant Epoch RPG

A solo or group play module for The Mutant Epoch RPG

Mayhem on the road • A subterranean escape • An epic solitaire saga

You’re on the run in the weeds and wreckage... and you aren’t alone, traveller. You’re being tracked, being surrounded, and likely the next meal for the hounds of the wastes. Your goal is to get to the excavator support town of Pitford, but the coming night, impending junk storm, and bizarre beasts of the scrub-land make the odds of that very remote. Getting off the surface might be your only hope.

Challenge Yourself
Grab your dice, a pencil, and your character sheets and immerse yourself in hours of unpredictable, epic adventure. See if your character can survive and if not, our condolences, so come join the Epochian community online and share your casualties by using the hashtag #DogDazeKIA on Instagram, twitter, or other social media.

This fast-paced, highly re-playable module can be used as a training ground for those new to the Outland System. Likewise, sections of this book can be inserted into a game master’s own dig sites and encounters, or slid into other published TME adventures. Only minor, 'on the fly' tweaks are needed to convert Dog Daze into a GM directed quest.

boardgame.name: Ancient Realm
boardgame.description:
A solo civilization game in just 18 cards.

—description from the publisher


This is a solo-only (although I have created rules to play head-to-head with two decks) game about building the best realm you can, as dictated by the number of victory points you earn.

There are three types of cards: storage cards that track your inventory (gold, stone, wood and grain), district cards that contain standard civ building blocks (citizens, production sites, gold mines) and ancient wonders that cost resources to build and earn you big points).

It is a card-laying game, where you draft a card from the queue and place it in your realm. Your realm is an evolving landscape made up of a single panoramic row, and each turn you'll be adding a card to expand your realm. You can cover part or entire cards in your realm if you wish, and for each block you cover you get to activate that block's power. Citizens give you one-time abilities, production sites generate new resources. Gold mines give you, you guessed it, gold.

At its heart, it's a civilization-building-themed puzzle game, where you're trying to maximize your points by deciding what blocks to keep and what blocks to build over, carefully managing your resources, and balancing end game scoring goal needs with immediate tactical needs.

—description from the designer
